Name: Commoner's Headband
Info: Hood of a rune cursed citizen
Caption: A headband that holds cloth in place. Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between. Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.

Name: Commoner's Headband (Altered)
Info: Garb of a rune cursed citizen
Caption: A headband with the cloth removed. Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between. Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.

Name: Aristocrat Headband
Info: Aristocrat headband, decorated with fine goldwork
Caption: Valuable headband featuring fine goldwork. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Name: Aristocrat Hat
Info: Aristocrat hat, decorated with a marcescent feather
Caption: Leather hat decorated with a withered feather. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital, and the belonging of a family which claims a knight as an ancestor. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Name: Old Aristocrat Cowl
Info: Aristocrat hood, made from superior cloth
Caption: Cowl made of soft cloth. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Name: Page Hood
Info: Hood worn by pages
Caption: Hood worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way. The unassuming sack-like appearance befits their unseen and unknown stature.

Name: High Page Hood
Info: Hood of a Page loyal to a certain noble family
Caption: Hood of a page selected for special privileges by the noble they serve. The unassuming sack-like appearance befits their unseen and unknown stature.

Name: Guardian Mask
Info: Mask worn by the people of rotted abundance
Caption: Engraved golden mask. Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees. In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.

Name: Festive Hood
Info: Hood worn for a humble festival
Caption: Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills. Decorated with many-colored flowers.

Name: Festive Hood (Altered)
Info: Wreath of flowers worn for a humble festival
Caption: Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills. Decorated with a stunning array of flowers.

Name: Blue Festive Hood
Info: Hood worn for a humble festival
Caption: Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills. Use of this hood, dyed in a stunning blue, is only permitted for the young maids who play the central role in the festival.

Name: Guilty Hood
Info: Coarse hooded cloak of olive brown
Caption: Coarse hooded cloak of olive brown. The garb of those accused of lesser crimes, indicated by the collar of sharpened branches.

Name: Prisoner Iron Mask
Info: Iron mask worn by grave offenders
Caption: Iron mask forced on a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime. Thick, heavy, and utterly stifling. A foul creation designed to torment the wearer, either slowly fermenting hatred within their heart, or a spiritual fervor that is near indistinguishable from it.

Name: Blackguard's Iron Mask
Info: Iron mask worn by only the most violent offenders
Caption: Iron mask forced on convicted prisoners. Worn by the blackguard Big Boggart. To Boggart, the mask made him all the more threatening, and helped him get what he wanted. But it was also a mirror of his emptiness.

Name: Bloodsoaked Mask
Info: Bandages dirtied with blood
Caption: Mask formed from tightly-wound bandages soaked through with blood. Even the most ghastly cover is more inviting than the festering face beneath.

Name: Black Dumpling
Info: Red cloth blindfold used to cover prisoners' eyes
Caption: Mask forced on a victim's head to lend torture an extra degree of cruelty. It magnifies one's fears and makes them acutely aware of all forms of pain. Raises attack power when the wearer suffers from madness. When the Black Dumpling goes on, the torturer no longer seeks answers; only to inflict suffering without hope of relief.

Name: Mushroom Head
Info: Helm with slime mold growing on it
Caption: Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushrooms have colonized the head. To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.

Name: Mushroom Crown
Info: Garland crown of large flowers rotted by poison
Caption: Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushrooms form a towering headpiece. Raises attack power when something nearby suffers from poison or rot. Long ago, great lords served the scarlet rot. Perhaps such fungal bodies served as their crowns.

Name: Astrologer Hood
Info: Hood of the glintstone polishers
Caption: Hood fashioned from supple cloth. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above. They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers. But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

Name: Juvenile Scholar Cap
Info: Cap worn by students of the Raya Lucaria Academy
Caption: Cap worn by young academy scholars, the juveniles birthed anew by the amber egg of Queen Rennala, the head of Raya Lucaria Academy. Yet their rebirth is not without imperfections, and thus do they repeat the process, eventually becoming utterly dependent upon it. Rebirth is as sleep to them, and with each awakening, memory fades into oblivion.

Name: Karolos Glintstone Crown
Info: Stone mask depicting the wise Karolos
Caption: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. Increases intelligence to the detriment of stamina. The Karolos Conspectus is the oldest of the academy's lineages of study, begat by the sorcerer Azur. Scholars who follow in his footsteps pursue the mysteries of comets.

Name: Olivinus Glintstone Crown
Info: Stone mask of a Gold Amber Sage
Caption: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. Increases intelligence to the detriment of HP. The lineage of the Olivinus Conspectus began with the sorcerer Lusat, and its adherents continue his study of meteors.

Name: Twinsage Glintstone Crown
Info: Stone mask of the Twin Crystal Sage
Caption: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. Greatly increases intelligence to the detriment of HP and stamina. Scholars of the Twinsage Conspectus were the elites of the academy, permitted to study and excel in sorceries of all kinds.

Name: Witch's Glintstone Crown
Info: Stone mask of a Green Glintstone Sage
Caption: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. Increases intelligence and arcane to the detriment of stamina. This gentle-looking crown was granted to a scholar who excelled in her studies, which also merited the title of "witch."

Name: Lazuli Glintstone Crown
Info: Stone mask of a Red Glintstone Sage
Caption: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. Increases intelligence and dexterity to the detriment of HP. Scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus study Carian sorceries—a heterodox pursuit that views the moon as equal to the stars.

Name: Haima Glintstone Crown
Info: Mask of an unaffiliated glintstone sorcerer
Caption: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. Increases intelligence and strength to the detriment of FP. Scholars of the Haima Conspectus sought the power to quell conflict, and to this end studied the sorceries of cannon fire and the gavel.

Name: Hierodas Glintstone Crown
Info: Eyepatch worn by a great sorcerer turned hermit
Caption: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. Increases intelligence and endurance to the detriment of FP. The crown of Hierodas was granted to scholars who engaged in nomadic study away from the academy.

Name: Spellblade's Pointed Hat
Info: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's hat
Caption: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills. Rogier spent his entire life behaving with utter detachment. No one noticed the anger, grief, regret, or fear that existed along with it.

Name: Alberich's Pointed Hat
Info: Hat of a defected glintstone sorcerer
Caption: Mad Tongue Alberich's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner. Set with red glintstones, said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthens thorn sorcery. Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

Name: Alberich's Pointed Hat (Altered)
Info: Cowl of a defected glintstone sorcerer
Caption: Mad Tongue Alberich's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner. Set with red glintstones, said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthens thorn sorcery. Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

Name: Preceptor's Big Hat
Info: Hat worn by ruthless Chaplains
Caption: Large hat with the movements of the stars drawn on the inside of the brim. Worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals. Increases mind to the detriment of stamina. Glintstone sorcerers are the descendants of astrologers, a fact that the Carians remain aware of. Even if their fate has been long severed from the stars.

Name: Mask of Confidence
Info: Hood worn by ruthless Chaplains
Caption: Mask with the mouth sewn shut with gold thread. Increases arcane. When Radagon married Rennala, he ordered the Carian magic preceptors to don these masks. To make it clear that all of their matters were to be kept strictly private.

Name: Azur's Glintstone Crown
Info: Blue transparent crown of a Crystal Sorcerer
Caption: Crown of Azur, primeval current sorcerer, set with a prominent blue-green glintstone. This crown replaced Azur's brain and skull altogether, and now, removed from his body, it is all but dead. What power remains within raises the potency of Azur's primeval current sorceries at the cost of additional FP consumption.

Name: Lusat's Glintstone Crown
Info: Skull-merged Crown of a Crystal Sorcerer
Caption: The giant blue glintstone crown worn by Lusat, primeval current sorcerer. This crown replaced Lusat's brain and skull altogether, and now, removed from his body, it is all but dead. What power remains within raises the potency of Lusat's primeval current sorceries at the cost of additional FP consumption.

Name: Queen's Crescent Crown
Info: Crown of Rennala, the Full Moon Witch
Caption: A tall crown depicting the moon. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. Increases intelligence. When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him. And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

Name: Snow Witch Hat
Info: Hat worn by Enchantress Ranni
Caption: Witch's pointed hat, frigid and frozen through. Of a style associated with practitioners of heretical sorcery. Strengthens cold sorcery. Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries. It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her. That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.

Name: Fia's Hood
Info: Hood worn by Phia, the Deathbed Companion
Caption: Hood of black cloth that covers the whole head. Worn by Fia, the Deathbed Companion, on her journey after being exiled from her home. The fabric itself is soft as silk.

Name: Prophet Blindfold
Info: Blindfold of the exiled prophets
Caption: Blindfold of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune—and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result. Why hesitate, if the path leading to the future is clear? Just close your eyes, and walk.

Name: Traveling Maiden Hood
Info: Hood worn by traveling clerics
Caption: Hood worn by traveling maidens. Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.

Name: Finger Maiden Fillet
Info: Crown worn by Saints
Caption: Fillet worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers. The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers. The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.

Name: Sage Hood
Info: Hood of a travelling musician gripped by death
Caption: A burgundy pointed hood. Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical. Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

Name: Greathood
Info: Hood with a mysterious silhouette
Caption: Hood far larger than the head it is meant to cover. A burial shroud of sorts for those who discover, at long last, the truth they sought. Increases intelligence and faith to the detriment of HP. "Yes, surely this is the moon that young Rennala gazed upon."

Name: Radiant Gold Mask
Info: Mask worn by researchers of the Golden Order
Caption: A mask designed to resemble a blazing golden halo. Created and left behind by Lord Goldmask, a staunch pursuer of Golden Order fundamentalism. Strengthens Golden Order incantations. Its striking design represents both the brilliant inspiration that once shone upon him, and the vision of a ring that he will surely find at the end of his pursuit. "To you who seek to shine as I do, wear it well!"

Name: Perfumer Hood
Info: Hood of an Erdtree Capital perfumer
Caption: Hood of an Erdtree Capital perfumer. In times past, the role of perfumer was much respected; a blessed apothecary in the eyes of the many. But after entering the battlefields of the Shattering they performed no such role, trading their aromatics for poisons and explosives.

Name: Traveler's Hat
Info: Leather tricorne of an unaffiliated perfumer
Caption: Hat of a traveling perfumer of no renown. An associate of a healer, he is said to be in search of new aromatics and flower gardens, in hopes of treating Misbegotten, Omen, and all those seen as impure.

Name: Depraved Perfumer Headscarf
Info: Hood of a depraved perfumer gripped by madness
Caption: Headscarf worn by depraved perfumers. These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is what earned them their name.

Name: Ruler's Mask
Info: Stone mask of Rya, servant to the Volcano Manor
Caption: Mask in the image of a wizened sage. Customary dress among lords in a smaller nation. Increases faith. Such a mask illustrates the qualities of an ideal lord: chiefly, wise and possessing a certain defanged geniality. One at the center of society often finds these qualities most expedient.

Name: Consort's Mask
Info: White mask of Tanith, Lady of the Volcano Manor
Caption: Mask worn by Tanith, Lady of the Volcano Manor, in the image of a foreign queen. Increases dexterity. Long ago, when Rykard first set eyes on Tanith, she was working as a dancer in a foreign land. Soon, he made her his consort. She was the only human to remain by his side when he became the serpent of blasphemy. In that moment, Tanith was truly charmed by him.

Name: Marais Mask
Info: An eerie white haired silver mask
Caption: Mask in the image of a white-haired young noble. Customarily worn by the head of House Marais. Increases arcane. The Marais family has a dual history spanning generations, serving as both executioners and castellans of the Shaded Castle. This mask bears the likeness of the first of their line.

Name: Great Horned Headband
Info: Headband worn by worshippers of stag specters
Caption: Headband decorated by a pair of great horns. Worn by ancestral follower warriors. The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

Name: Shining Horned Headband
Info: %null%
Caption: Headband decorated by a pair of shining horns. Worn by ancestral follower shamans. Horns with buds that also shine are ideal ceremonial items for ancestral worship. Strengthens Ancestral Infant's Head.

Name: Godskin Apostle Hood
Info: Hood made from tanned Demigod skin
Caption: Hood made by sewing together patches of smooth skin. Worn by the Godskin Apostles. The apostles, once said to serve Destined Death, are wielders of the god-slaying black flame. But after their defeat by Maliketh, the Black Blade, the source of their power was sealed away.

Name: Godskin Noble Hood
Info: Hood made from tanned corpulent Demigod skin
Caption: Hood made by sewing together patches of smooth skin. Subcutaneous fat makes it plump and soft. Worn by Godskin Nobles. Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.

Name: Sanguine Noble Hood
Info: Hood of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery
Caption: Hood of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery. Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood. Known to strike from pools of blood, these assassins are missionaries come to share the gospel of accursed blood.

Name: Crimson Tear Scarab
Info: Mask made from a large, old yellow scarab's body
Caption: Red scarab worn directly on the head. The red scarabs roll clumps of crimson tears during their labors. Slightly increases the recovery effects of the Flask of Crimson Tears, but increases damage taken.

Name: Cerulean Tear Scarab
Info: Mask made from a large, old green scarab's body
Caption: Blue scarab worn directly on the head. These scarabs roll clumps of cerulean tears during their labors. Slightly increases the recovery effects of the Flask of Cerulean Tears, but increases damage taken.

Name: Ash-of-War Scarab
Info: Mask made from a large, old white scarab's body
Caption: Gray scarab worn directly on the head. These scarabs roll clumps of Ashes of War during their labors. Slightly reduces the FP cost of skills, but increases damage taken.

Name: Glintstone Scarab
Info: Mask made from a large, old blue scarab's body
Caption: Blue-green scarab worn directly on the head. These scarabs roll clumps of sorcery during their labors. Slightly reduces the FP costs of sorceries, but increases damage taken.

Name: Incantation Scarab
Info: Mask made from a large, old red scarab's body
Caption: Golden scarab worn directly on the head. These scarabs roll clumps of incantations during their labors. Slightly reduces the FP costs of incantations, but increases damage taken. As a scarab approaches death, it abandons its rolled treasure and stretches its wings wide for the long journey to its home nest.

Name: Imp Head (Cat)
Info: Ancient mask with an animal motif
Caption: Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. Resembling a cat, it holds trace amounts of feline intelligence.

Name: Imp Head (Wolf)
Info: Ancient mask with an animal motif
Caption: Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. Resembling a wolf, it holds trace amounts of lupine endurance.

Name: Imp Head (Fanged)
Info: Ancient mask with an animal motif
Caption: Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. Resembling a fanged demon, it holds trace amounts of bestial strength.

Name: Imp Head (Long-Tongued)
Info: Ancient mask with an animal motif
Caption: Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. Resembling a long-tongued demon, it holds trace amounts of vexatious dexterity.

Name: Imp Head (Corpse)
Info: Ancient mask with an animal motif
Caption: Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. Resembling the visage of a corpse, it holds trace amounts of lingering faith.

Name: Imp Head (Elder)
Info: Ancient mask with an animal motif
Caption: Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. Resembling an elder, it holds trace amounts of arcane knowledge.

Name: Nox Mirrorhelm
Info: Shining helm decorated with a mirror
Caption: Helm fashioned from a crystal looking-glass. One among the Eternal City's ritual implements. Easily broken and weak against striking attacks. Worn by those committed to high treason, it wards off the intervention of the Greater Will and its vassal Fingers.

Name: Iji's Mirrorhelm
Info: Shining helm decorated on all sides with mirrors
Caption: Helm fashioned from a crystal looking-glass, said to have never left War Counselor Iji's head. Easily broken and weak against striking attacks. Worn by those committed to high treason, it wards off the intervention of the Greater Will and its vassal Fingers. Iji was afraid. Terrified of his own treachery.

Name: Silver Tear Mask
Info: Head covering formed from silver tears
Caption: Mask fashioned from the corpse of a formless Silver Tear, supported by its hardened, shed husk. Greatly increases arcane to the detriment of physical attack power. To imitate the imitator is a cunning play indeed.

Name: Envoy Crown
Info: Head concealing silver robe
Caption: The soft bundle worn on the head by Oracle Envoys. Densely wrapped in several layers of cloth. Raises the potency of bubble-based skills. No one knows what the cloth hides, but some claim to have heard a faint whimpering from inside. It must have been their imagination.

Name: Octopus Head
Info: Helm modeled after a Land Octopus
Caption: A land octopus whelp worn directly on the head. Has a lingering warmth reminiscent of human skin. Those who can withstand the smell will find its organic elasticity excellent for negating strikes.

Name: Jar
Info: This sturdy jar might serve well as a helm
Caption: Jar that fits cleanly over the head when upturned. Made with pride by Iron Fist Alexander. In a uniquely jarlike gesture of friendship, it boosts the power of throwing pot items.

Name: Albinauric Mask
Info: Helm modeled after the silent Frog People
Caption: Mask made from the largely unaltered hide of a young Albinauric. Raises arcane, but reduces the HP recovery effects of the Flask of Crimson Tears. A far cry from godskin, this Albinauric hide mask is the product of malicious mockery.

Name: Black Wolf Mask
Info: Helm made with the head of an old wolf
Caption: A mask fashioned after the head of a black wolf. Relic of an assassin who assumed the guise of Ranni the Witch's loyal shadow. The likeness is striking.

Name: Blue Cloth Cowl
Info: Cowl of a nomadic warrior, made of blue cloth
Caption: Cowl of a nomadic warrior. The blue color of its fabric symbolizes brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer. Just as still waters turn foul, stagnation leads to decay. Warriors must remain ever drifting.

Name: Crimson Hood
Info: Hooded cloak of expatriated royalty
Caption: A hooded cloak of vivid crimson. Worn by expatriated royalty. Increases vigor. Such cloaks were gifted to those who departed on journeys without specific orders, to faraway lands from which they would never return. In other words, the gift of a cloak made it easier for undesirables to be on their way. Roderika never once saw the guidance of grace.

Name: Navy Hood
Info: Hooded cloak of expatriated royalty
Caption: A hooded cloak of deep navy. Worn by expatriated royalty. Increases mind. Such cloaks were gifted to those who departed on missions to faraway lands, from which they would never return. But what choice did they have, having seen the guidance of grace?

Name: White Mask
Info: Strange birch mask that hides one's expression
Caption: Bloodstained, faintly grinning white mask. Worn by war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers. The Lord of Blood's curse enlivens the wearer when bloodletting occurs. Slightly raises attack power when there is blood loss nearby.

Name: Nomadic Merchant's Chapeau
Info: Peddler Kalé's hat
Caption: Chapeau of the nomadic merchants. Decorated with tiny gems in a wide spectrum of colors. These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground. Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.

Name: Bandit Mask
Info: Dirty garb worn by bandits
Caption: Mask of black cloth that covers the mouth. Favored by bandits for hiding their faces, it also provides some protection against poison.

Name: Black Hood
Info: Dirty hood worn by bandits
Caption: Hood of lusterless black fabric that conceals its wearer's identity. In this world, there is very little that must necessarily be known.

Name: Confessor Hood
Info: Black hood of those who kill for a living
Caption: Black hood for blending in with the darkness. Worn by church confessors. The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace. The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

Name: Confessor Hood (Altered)
Info: Mask of those who kill for a living
Caption: Cloth headwrap worn under a church confessor's black hood. Such hoods are made for blending in with the darkness.

Name: Omensmirk Mask
Info: Mask worn by Executioners
Caption: Mask with long, hideously twisted horns worn by the Omenkillers. Increases strength. Bears the smirking face of an elder, twisted in wicked delight. This visage is carved in the image of the evil spirits that haunt the Omen in their nightmares.

Name: Skeletal Mask
Info: Hood worn by followers of the deadly birds
Caption: Skeletal mask that tightly grips the face. Worn by the assassins of Ravenmount. This ritual implement relentlessly digs into the wearer's face, preserving one's human instincts while dressed in imitation of the Deathbirds.

Name: Foot Soldier Helm
Info: Helm used by Caelid Wilds Patrol Soldiers
Caption: Wholly unembellished iron helm. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

Name: Foot Soldier Helmet
Info: Helm used by Raya Lucaria Academy Soldiers
Caption: Helmet with a protective metal plate. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

Name: Foot Soldier Cap
Info: Helm used by Stormveil Soldiers
Caption: Flanged iron cap widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

Name: Gilded Foot Soldier Cap
Info: Helm used by Capital Soldiers
Caption: Flanged cap made from gilded iron. Issued to foot soldiers protecting the royal capital of Leyndell.

Name: Sacred Crown Helm
Info: Helm used by Miquella's Soldiers
Caption: Flanged iron cap adorned with a crown of unalloyed gold. Increases faith. Worn by foot soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. Who is it that Miquella shall bless, if not the low and the meek?

Name: Highwayman Hood
Info: Hood worn by cave-dwelling foot soldiers
Caption: Hideously stained and ragged hood. Worn by former foot soldiers who have turned to banditry.

Name: Vulgar Militia Helm
Info: Helm worn by wandering soldiers
Caption: Helm worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen. The upward extension serves to create an appearance of larger size, however slightly.

Name: Duelist Helm
Info: Bronze helm adorned with many snakes
Caption: Bronze helm decorated with innumerable snakes. Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes. The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

Name: Rotten Duelist Helm
Info: Scarlet-bronze helm adorned with many snakes
Caption: Bronze helm decorated with innumerable snakes, eaten through by scarlet rot. Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

Name: Nox Monk Hood
Info: Hood worn by members of the Empyrean family
Caption: Silk hood worn by the monks of the Eternal City. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

Name: Nox Monk Hood (Altered)
Info: Headband worn by members of the Empyrean family
Caption: Hood worn by the monks of the Eternal City. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

Name: Nox Swordstress Crown
Info: Crown worn by members of the Empyrean family
Caption: Crown worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City. These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens, and the silk hides their eyes. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

Name: Nox Swordstress Crown (Altered)
Info: Crown worn by members of the Empyrean family
Caption: Crown worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City. The silk eye covering is removed, flaunting convention. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

Name: Night Maiden Twin Crown
Info: Crown worn by members of the Empyrean family
Caption: Twin crowns worn by the nightmaidens of the Eternal City. Indicates the highest clerical rank, and hides the eyes with silk. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

Name: Champion Headband
Info: Headband reserved for the badlands' bravest
Caption: Headband reserved for the badlands' bravest. Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes. Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

Name: Chain Coif
Info: Helm made of woven chain
Caption: Coif made of woven chain. Standard issue for ordinary soldiers. Though plain in appearance, it offers dependable protection.

Name: Iron Helmet
Info: An ordinary iron helmet
Caption: An iron helmet showing rust on its edges. Cloth covering the mouth and neck provides some resistance to poison and other irritants.

Name: Godrick Soldier Helm
Info: Helm used by Stormveil Knights
Caption: Helm worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted. Made from durable iron, layered with a chainmail coif beneath.

Name: Raya Lucarian Helm
Info: Helm used by Raya Lucaria Academy Knights
Caption: Helm worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers. Its brow is adorned with a single cuckoo's feather.

Name: Radahn Soldier Helm
Info: Helm used by Caelid Wilds Knights
Caption: Helm worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side. Its visor is fashioned after a lion's fangs.

Name: Leyndell Soldier Helm
Info: Helm used by Capital Knights
Caption: Helm worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. Made from durable iron, layered with a chainmail coif beneath.

Name: Haligtree Helm
Info: Helm used by Knights of Miquella
Caption: Helm worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. An iron helm graced by a crown of unalloyed gold. Increases faith.

Name: Exile Hood
Info: Deep red hood that covers the whole head
Caption: Deep red hood that covers the whole head. Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies, who were required to keep their faces hidden.

Name: Kaiden Helm
Info: Helm worn by Kaiden sellswords
Caption: Helm worn by Kaiden sellswords. These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback. Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

Name: Land of Reeds Helm
Info: Helm of a warrior from the land of reeds
Caption: Helm made from strips of iron fastened together. Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds. The Land of Reeds has long been locked in a miserable civil war, during which time it has remained alienated from the cultures of its neighbors. Little wonder that the entire nation has succumbed to blood-soaked madness, or so it is said.

Name: Okina Mask
Info: Mask adorned with a land of reeds veteran warrior
Caption: A wooden mask that depicts an old man bearing his teeth. The source of the sobriquet of the great swordsman of the Land of Reeds. Raises dexterity as it lowers focus. The more he sharpened his mind, the more the absurdities of the world came into stark relief. And so Okina renounced it all, and rose to a higher plane. There was only himself. His katana. And its mastery. Before long, Okina became a demon of a swordsman.

Name: Iron Kasa
Info: Bloody Finger Hunter Yura's umbrella
Caption: Iron kasa of the man who calls himself Shabriri. Crafted to imitate the woven straw hats worn in the Land of Reeds. The man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart.

Name: Eccentric's Hood
Info: Deathwatch, Jerren's hood
Caption: A pointy, ragged hood. Worn by the knight Jerren. The hood hides an aged, bearded mask. Jerren served General Radahn as a guest commander, and they are said to have sworn an oath of honorable death to one another.

Name: Eccentric's Hood (Altered)
Info: Deathwatch, Jerren's helm
Caption: A pointy, ragged hood. Worn by the knight Jerren. The hood hides an aged, bearded mask. Jerren served General Radahn as a guest commander, and they are said to have sworn an oath of honorable death to one another.

Name: Marionette Soldier Helm
Info: Cylindrical helm worn by marionette soldiers
Caption: Cylindrical helm of plate metal reinforced with a lattice. Worn by marionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers. The construction of this helm is remarkably crude. For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.

Name: Marionette Soldier Birdhelm
Info: Iron mask worn by marionette soldiers
Caption: Metal helm formed in the likeness of the face of a bird. Worn by avionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers. The construction of this helm is remarkably crude. For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.

Name: Blue Silver Mail Hood
Info: Chainmail hood made of motherly silver
Caption: Chainmail hood crafted with blue silver. Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers. Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.

Name: Fire Monk Hood
Info: Mail helm covering a headband engraved with flames
Caption: Mail hood of iron links covering a headband engraved with flames. Attire of the Fire Monks. The Fire Monks are guardians of the flame of ruin, forbidden by the Erdtree and said to be kept high in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

Name: Blackflame Monk Hood
Info: Chain helm worn above a fire shaped crown
Caption: Mail hood of iron links covering a headband engraved with flames. Attire of the Blackflame Monks. The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

Name: Zamor Mask
Info: Mask worn by an ancient hero
Caption: Mask worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants. These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

Name: Black Knife Hood
Info: Hood used by the Black Blade Assassins
Caption: Hood used by the Black Knife Assassins. The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

Name: Malenia's Winged Helm
Info: Helm of Arbitress Malenia
Caption: Winged helm made of unalloyed gold. Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella. Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk. "My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god—he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."

Name: Elden Lord Crown
Info: Crown of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord
Caption: Crown of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield. He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

Name: Knight Helm
Info: Iron helm worn by foreign knights
Caption: Iron helm of an unknown knight. It is made of thin iron plate. Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.

Name: Vagabond Knight Helm
Info: Helm of a banished knight
Caption: Helm of a knight banished from their motherland. Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey. The visor is broken and can no longer be lowered. Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

Name: Greathelm
Info: Sturdy helm made from iron
Caption: Sturdy greathelm made from iron. Though it is uncomfortably heavy and obstructs the vision of the wearer, it provides considerable damage negation.

Name: Carian Knight Helm
Info: Helm of enchanted Carian knights
Caption: Helm of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family. The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were all heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

Name: Godrick Knight Helm
Info: Helm used by Stormveil Elite Knights
Caption: Helm worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted. Adorned with a plume of withered, ashen hair.

Name: Cuckoo Knight Helm
Info: Helm of Raya Lucaria Academy Elite Knights
Caption: Helm worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights. Its brow is adorned with a single cuckoo's feather.

Name: Redmane Knight Helm
Info: Helm used by Elite Caelid Wilds Knights
Caption: Helm worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side. The red plume is a symbol of Radahn's pedigree as Lord Radagon's son—the mane of the proud Red Lion.

Name: Gelmir Knight Helm
Info: Helm used by Capital Knights
Caption: Helm worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard. Its crest of red feathers symbolizes Rykard's pedigree as Lord Radagon's son.

Name: Leyndell Knight Helm
Info: Helm used by Elite Capital Knights
Caption: Helm worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. The golden canopy represents the honor of standing among the tree's defenders.

Name: Haligtree Knight Helm
Info: Helm used by Elite Knights of Miquella
Caption: Helm worn by knights sworn to the Haligtree. Graced by a crown of unalloyed gold. Increases faith.

Name: Bloodhound Knight Helm
Info: Beast-like helm of the Bloodhound Knights
Caption: Metal helm with a pointed beak. Worn by the Bloodhound Knights. The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers. Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master. Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

Name: Cleanrot Helm
Info: Helm of a Wing Knight. Somewhat decayed...
Caption: Winged helm of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering. The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.

Name: Cleanrot Helm (Altered)
Info: Light helm of a Wing Knight. Somewhat decayed…
Caption: Winged helm of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering. The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.

Name: Raging Wolf Helm
Info: Helm of Vargram the Bloody Wolf
Caption: Helm worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold. Vargram's nickname comes from the white wolf's mane that decorates this helm.

Name: Hoslow's Helm
Info: Heavy helm passed down through the Hoslow family
Caption: A twin-tailed silver helm decorated with flowery adornments. Symbol of the head of the revered House of Hoslow. Juno Hoslow had a younger brother who was all talk and no trousers. His inability to commit to action was such that Juno inherited the Hoslow legacy without resistance, granting him the freedom to shower his little brother with adoration.

Name: Diallos's Mask
Info: Helm passed down through the Hoslow family
Caption: Replica of a twin-tailed silver helm with flowery adornments. Only, without the twin tails. Diallos Hoslow had an older brother who was a stern, self-possessed man of few words. His achievements made him seem out of reach. And so the younger aspired to be like the older. Yearning for the day that he would tell the tale of House Hoslow, in blood. Knowing full well that it would break his brother's heart.

Name: Twinned Helm
Info: Helm worn by D, Knight of the Golden Order
Caption: Helm depicting entwined twins of gold and silver. The two known as D are inseparable twins. They are of two bodies and two minds, but one single soul. Not once do they stand together; not one word do they speak to one another. Perhaps this armor longs to find its way to the other D.

Name: Drake Knight Helm
Info: Malformed helm fused with dragon flesh
Caption: Black iron helm worn by drake knights. Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion. From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe.

Name: Drake Knight Helm (Altered)
Info: Malformed light helm fused with dragon flesh
Caption: Black iron helm worn by drake knights. Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion. From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe.

Name: Briar Helm
Info: Helm worn by Condor Knights
Caption: Battered iron helm from a foreign land. Worn by Elemer of the Briar. The winding, rusted iron briars are a mark of the guilty, and typically indicate a sentence of death. Elemer murdered numerous instructors and merchants, and was known as the Bell Bearing Hunter.

Name: Fingerprint Helm
Info: Deformed helm of a mad knight in despair
Caption: Iron helm singed and blistered by fingers. Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold. No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy. Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?

Name: Royal Remains Helm
Info: Mask that mediates via body of famed ancestor
Caption: Helm graced with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing. Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced. It is said that the bones belong to an ancient lord―the soulless king. The lord of the lost and desperate, who was known as Ensha.

Name: All-Knowing Helm
Info: Helm of Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing
Caption: Helm set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. At the end that should not be.

Name: Royal Knight Helm
Info: Helm of an Arbor Sentinel
Caption: Silver helm of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree. Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

Name: Maliketh's Helm
Info: Helm of Maliketh the Black Blade
Caption: Beast's helm made of black iron and decorated with gold. Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade. Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him. Champions knew what was at stake. Indeed, that is what made them champions.

Name: Banished Knight Helm
Info: Knight's helm covered in a long cloth of deep red
Caption: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. This helm was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. Perhaps the deep-red scarf was used to block the winds, for on the outskirts, the winds bite with a stinging fierceness.

Name: Banished Knight Helm (Altered)
Info: Helm of a Stormveil Knight
Caption: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. This helm was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

Name: Night's Cavalry Helm
Info: Helm covered in blackened bloodstains
Caption: Pitch-black helm with flowing black hair. Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds. The Night's Cavalry, who now wander the dim roads of night, were once led by the Fell Omen and were deliverers of death for great warriors, knights, and champions.

Name: Night's Cavalry Helm (Altered)
Info: Light helm covered in blackened bloodstains
Caption: Pitch-black helm thinly painted with dried blood. Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds. The Night's Cavalry, who now wander the dim roads of night, were once led by the Fell Omen and were deliverers of death for great warriors, knights, and champions.

Name: Veteran's Helm
Info: Veteran General's old helm
Caption: An old helm that has seen many battles. Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol. Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master. This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

Name: Scaled Helm
Info: Helm made from layered ancient dragon scales
Caption: Helm worn by Old Knight Istvan. The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it highly effective against non-physical attacks. Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survive to this day.

Name: Beast Champion Helm
Info: Helm of Belnahr the Traitor
Caption: Silver helm engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant. The beasts, their eyes and ears covered, represent an oath: "See nothing, hear nothing, doubt nothing, and carry on, along the path set in stone."

Name: Tree Sentinel Helm
Info: Helm of a Tree Sentinel
Caption: Golden helm of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree. Very few are permitted to wear a golden wood crest of such size as seen on this helm.

Name: Malformed Dragon Helm
Info: Malformed, golden helm used by Gnarrl
Caption: A malformed golden helm. Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels. After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.

Name: Crucible Axe Helm
Info: Helm used by Ordovis of the Crucible and his men
Caption: Helm of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. The axe ornamentation is the knight Ordovis's mark, displayed also by his men. Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

Name: Crucible Tree Helm
Info: Helm used by Siluria of the Crucible and her men
Caption: Helm of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. The great tree ornamentation is the knight Siluria's mark, displayed also by her men. Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

Name: Radahn's Redmane Helm
Info: Helm of Radahn, God of War
Caption: Helm of the golden lion, with flowing red hair. Worn by General Radahn. Radahn inherited the furious, flaming red hair of his father Radagon, and is fond of its heroic implications. "I was born a champion's cub. Now I am the Lord of the Battlefield's lion."

Name: Lionel's Helm
Info: Oddly shaped helm used by foreign knights
Caption: Round iron helm with a distinctive large brim. Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted. When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.

Name: Bull-Goat Helm
Info: Great Horned Tragoth's helm
Caption: Great Horned Tragoth's helm, adorned with a gold bull-goat motif. Provides high poise. Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.

Name: Omen Helm
Info: Mask of a curse gnawed Omen
Caption: Malformed helm resembling an Omen with its horns cut off. Worn by the Dung Eater, its form is a vision of the landscape of his mind, and of his appearance as he wished to see it. The heart of an Omen without the body to match; could there be any crueler existence? What does it matter, then, if the curse claims it all?

Name: Fire Prelate Helm
Info: Fire Prelate helm sculpted in the image of a sage
Caption: Helm engraved with a sacred countenance and housing a cauldron. Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks. It is said the cauldron perched atop the head was originally furnished with embers, and would surge into flames when the wearer's faith reached its zenith. The fire of this cauldron has since died out, however.

Name: Pumpkin Helm
Info: Oval helmet large enough to cover any head
Caption: An oval helm large enough to cover any head. Very heavy and very hard. Reduces damage from headshots and impacts. The inside of the helm is pitch black, keeping the crazed warrior within from panicking. Perhaps its rather roomy interior also helps alleviate feelings of pressure and claustrophobia.

Name: Ragged Hat
Info: Helm pieced together from scavenged metal
Caption: Helm pieced together from scavenged metal.

Name: Ragged Hat (Altered)
Info: Helm pieced together from scavenged metal
Caption: Helm pieced together from scavenged metal.

Name: Brave's Cord Circlet
Info: Headband of a warrior of the frigid uplands
Caption: Warrior's headband of woven leather. Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands. The small flags, white cloths and sheaves of wheat often found hung from these headbands are prayers of farewell from the people of their home. In bidding farewell to warriors departing on a journey from which they aren't like to return, this small act offers only meager relief.

Name: Brave's Leather Helm
Info: Helm of a warrior of the frigid uplands
Caption: Battlewear wrapped in thick leather. Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

Name: Grass Hair Ornament
Info: Headdress made from wildflowers
Caption: A headdress made from wildflowers. Wearing this might make you less easy to spot.

Name: Cloth Garb
Info: Garb made of rough material
Caption: Clothing made of coarse material, commonly worn in the Lands Between.

Name: Traveler's Clothes
Info: Robe worn by Malenia
Caption: Light yet sturdy clothes. Worn by young women who set off into the world to confront their fate.

Name: Commoner's Simple Garb
Info: Crown of a rune cursed citizen
Caption: Garb with a modest cloth cape attached. Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between. The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.

Name: Commoner's Simple Garb (Altered)
Info: Garb of a rune cursed citizen
Caption: Modest garb made of cloth. Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between. The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.

Name: Commoner's Garb
Info: Garb of a rune cursed citizen
Caption: Garb with a thick embroidered cape attached. Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between. The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.

Name: Commoner's Garb (Altered)
Info: Garb of a rune cursed citizen
Caption: Garb decorated with intricate embroidery. Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between. The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.

Name: Aristocrat Garb
Info: Aristocrat garb featuring fine gold embroidery
Caption: High quality garb adorned with fine golden embroidery. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Terribly faded and tattered. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Name: Aristocrat Garb (Altered)
Info: Aristocrat garb, adorned with golden embroidery
Caption: High quality garb adorned with fine golden embroidery. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Terribly faded and tattered. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Name: Aristocrat Coat
Info: Aristocrat coat featuring fine gold embroidery
Caption: Tanned leather coat adorned with fine gold embroidery. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital, and the belonging of a family which claims a knight as an ancestor. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Name: Old Aristocrat Gown
Info: Aristocrat gown featuring fine gold embroidery
Caption: Gown of soft cloth adorned with fine gold embroidery. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Name: Page Garb
Info: Garb worn by pages
Caption: Garb worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way. Traveling wear tailored with exquisite precision, to avoid any undue shame for the page's master.

Name: Page Garb (Altered)
Info: Tunic worn by pages
Caption: Garb worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way. Traveling wear tailored with exquisite precision, to avoid any undue shame for the page's master.

Name: High Page Clothes
Info: Garb of a Page loyal to a certain noble family
Caption: Clothes of a page selected for special privileges by the noble they serve. Traveling wear tailored with exquisite precision, to avoid any undue shame for the page's master.

Name: High Page Clothes (Altered)
Info: Vest of a Page loyal to a certain noble family
Caption: Clothes of a page selected for special privileges by the noble they serve. Traveling wear tailored with exquisite precision, to avoid any undue shame for the page's master.

Name: Guardian Garb
Info: Vest worn by the people of rotted abundance
Caption: Engraved golden garb. Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees. In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.

Name: Guardian Garb (Full Bloom)
Info: Armor worn by the people of rotted abundance
Caption: Engraved golden garb. Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees. Raises the HP recovery effects of the Flask of Crimson Tears, but greatly lowers fire damage negation. It is said that the blood-red flowers blooming on their backs mark the senescence of their ancient pact. Perhaps the guardians are part tree already.

Name: Festive Garb
Info: Cloak worn for a humble festival
Caption: Ceremonial garb worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills. Faintly bloodstained.

Name: Festive Garb (Altered)
Info: Ceremonial garb worn for a humble festival
Caption: Ceremonial garb worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills. Faintly bloodstained.

Name: Blue Festive Garb
Info: Cloak worn for a humble festival
Caption: Ceremonial garb worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills. Use of this garb, dyed in a stunning blue, is only permitted for the young maids who play the central role in the festival.

Name: Prisoner Clothing
Info: Tattered clothing
Caption: Tattered clothing. Worn by a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime. Never once washed, every fiber is filthy.

Name: Mushroom Body
Info: Armor with slime mold growing on it
Caption: Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushrooms have colonized the torso. To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.

Name: Astrologer Robe
Info: Robe of the glintstone polishers
Caption: Robe fashioned from supple cloth. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above. They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers. But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

Name: Astrologer Robe (Altered)
Info: Robe of the glintstone polishers
Caption: Robe fashioned from supple cloth. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above. They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers. But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

Name: Juvenile Scholar Robe
Info: Robe worn by students of the Raya Lucaria Academy
Caption: Robe worn by young academy scholars, the juveniles birthed anew by the amber egg of Queen Rennala, the head of Raya Lucaria Academy. Yet their rebirth is not without imperfections, and thus do they repeat the process, eventually becoming utterly dependent upon it. Rebirth is as sleep to them, and with each awakening, memory fades into oblivion.

Name: Raya Lucarian Robe
Info: Robe worn by Raya Lucaria's magic scholars
Caption: Robe worn by Raya Lucaria's scholars of sorcery. Those who dedicate themselves to the study of glintstones formed from starry amber receive this modest yet elegant deep navy garb after making their vows of virtue and austerity. But with extended life, one is apt to forget old vows.

Name: Lazuli Robe
Info: Sorcerer's robe, dyed in a beautiful cerulean hue
Caption: Robe worn by scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus, singular among the greater Raya Lucaria Academy. These scholars, who sought to master Carian sorcery, instead learned to see the moon as equal to the stars. This robe, in the hue of the full moon, signifies their heresy.

Name: Battlemage Robe
Info: Robe of an unaffiliated glintstone sorcerer
Caption: Robe worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy scholar, tattered from being worn on the battlefield. Whenever war broke out and the academy sealed its gates, only Haima's scholars dared venture outside. Seclusion is no way to foster discovery; it is only a convenient form of escape.

Name: Errant Sorcerer Robe
Info: Cape worn by a great sorcerer turned hermit
Caption: Commonplace robe made of thick cloth. Worn by the Errant Sorcerer Wilhelm, one of the first Tarnished to visit Roundtable Hold. A silent seeker of sorcery, who had gone so far as to make contact with the primeval current, Wilhelm was led by guidance into confrontation with his friend Vargram, and it is said that he was then taken prisoner in Roundtable Hold.

Name: Errant Sorcerer Robe (Altered)
Info: Tunic worn by a great sorcerer turned hermit
Caption: Commonplace robe made of thick cloth. Worn by the Errant Sorcerer Wilhelm, one of the first Tarnished to visit Roundtable Hold. A silent seeker of sorcery, who had gone so far as to make contact with the primeval current, Wilhelm was led by guidance into confrontation with his friend Vargram, and it is said that he was then taken prisoner in Roundtable Hold.

Name: Spellblade's Traveling Attire
Info: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's cape
Caption: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's traveling attire, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills. Rogier spent his entire life behaving with utter detachment. No one noticed the anger, grief, regret, or fear that existed along with it.

Name: Spellblade's Traveling Attire (Altered)
Info: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's vest
Caption: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's traveling attire, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills. Rogier spent his entire life behaving with utter detachment. No one noticed the anger, grief, regret, or fear that existed along with it.

Name: Alberich's Robe
Info: Robe of a defected glintstone sorcerer
Caption: Mad Tongue Alberich's robe. Set with red glintstones, said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthens thorn sorcery. Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

Name: Alberich's Robe (Altered)
Info: Tunic of a defected glintstone sorcerer
Caption: Mad Tongue Alberich's robe. Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

Name: Preceptor's Long Gown
Info: Gown worn by ruthless Chaplains
Caption: A long, bright blue gown with the movements of the stars drawn upon it. Worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals. Glintstone sorcerers are the descendants of astrologers, a fact that the Carians remain aware of. Even if their fate has been long severed from the stars.

Name: Preceptor's Long Gown (Altered)
Info: Vest worn by ruthless Chaplains
Caption: Modest garb, previously worn under a long, bright blue gown with the movements of the stars drawn upon it.

Name: Azur's Glintstone Robe
Info: Blue transparent robe of a Crystal Sorcerer
Caption: A robe reserved for grand masters at the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Corroded by blue-green glintstones. Since the grand masters Azur and Lusat were driven from the academy, no one has achieved their formerly-held rank.

Name: Lusat's Robe
Info: Dull red robe of a Crystal Sorcerer
Caption: A robe reserved for grand masters at the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Corroded by blue glintstones. Since the grand masters Azur and Lusat were driven from the academy, no one has achieved their formerly-held rank.

Name: Queen's Robe
Info: Robe of Rennala, the Full Moon Witch
Caption: Robe indicating the highest order of sorcerer. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him. And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

Name: Snow Witch Robe
Info: Robe worn by Enchantress Ranni
Caption: Witch's robe in the color of snow. Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries. It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her. That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.

Name: Snow Witch Robe (Altered)
Info: Dress worn by Enchantress Ranni
Caption: Witch's robe in the color of snow. Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries. It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her. That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.

Name: Fia's Robe
Info: Robe worn by Phia, the Deathbed Companion
Caption: Robe of black cloth that covers the entire body. Worn by Fia, the Deathbed Companion, on her journey after being exiled from her home. The fabric itself is soft as silk and thin enough that those embraced can feel every pulse; every bit of her warmth.

Name: Fia's Robe (Altered)
Info: Gown worn by Phia, the Deathbed Companion
Caption: Robe of black cloth that covers the entire body. Worn by Fia, the Deathbed Companion, on her journey after being exiled from her home. The fabric itself is soft as silk and thin enough that those embraced can feel every pulse; every bit of her warmth.

Name: Deathbed Dress
Info: Dress worn by Phia, the Deathbed Companion
Caption: Extremely thin and sheer white dress worn by the Deathbed Companion as she embraces the dead. Slowly replenishes the HP of nearby allies, but not that of the wearer. The touch of the fabric is exceedingly soft, so as not to harm even the most withered corpse, while still sharing her warmth.

Name: Prophet Robe
Info: Tunic of the exiled prophets
Caption: Robe of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune—and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result. The shackles around the neck warn passersby not to lend an ear to their sermons.

Name: Prophet Robe (Altered)
Info: Robe of the exiled prophets
Caption: Robe of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune—and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result. Made from rough fabric that scrapes against the skin like a sharpening file.

Name: Corhyn's Robe
Info: Robe of the exiled prophets
Caption: Robe of Corhyn the cleric. Even after exile, Corhyn refused to recant his prophecies. And for this, he was blessed with the guidance of grace. Since then, the cart wheel draped on his neck has served as a reminder. That true guidance awaits those with iron wills. Those with unwavering faith.

Name: Traveling Maiden Robe
Info: Robe worn by traveling clerics
Caption: Robe worn by traveling maidens. Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.

Name: Traveling Maiden Robe (Altered)
Info: Tunic worn by traveling clerics
Caption: Modest garb of traveling maidens, typically worn under their robes.

Name: Finger Maiden Robe
Info: Dress worn by Saints
Caption: Robe worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers. The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers. The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.

Name: Finger Maiden Robe (Altered)
Info: Tunic worn by Saints
Caption: Robe worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers. The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers. The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.

Name: Sage Robe
Info: Robe of a travelling musician gripped by death
Caption: Thick burgundy robe. Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical. Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

Name: Goldmask's Rags
Info: Robe worn by researchers of the Golden Order
Caption: Worn rags that just barely cover the body. Lord Goldmask felt no draw to the vain excesses of clothing; what use is finery to one who seeks greater brilliance?

Name: Perfumer Robe
Info: Robe of an Erdtree Capital perfumer
Caption: Robe of an Erdtree Capital perfumer. The thick front apron embroidered with a depiction of the Erdtree is proof of mastery of the apothecarial arts, and its weight symbolizes the onus of both pride and responsibility.

Name: Perfumer Robe (Altered)
Info: Tunic of an Erdtree Capital perfumer
Caption: Robe of an Erdtree Capital perfumer. The thick front apron embroidered with a depiction of the Erdtree is proof of mastery of the apothecarial arts, and its weight symbolizes the onus of both pride and responsibility.

Name: Perfumer's Traveling Garb
Info: Robe of an unaffiliated perfumer
Caption: Garb of a traveling perfumer of no renown. The thick front apron, the badge of a perfumer, has been replaced with a more simple one made from soft leather.

Name: Perfumer's Traveling Garb (Altered)
Info: Tunic of an unaffiliated perfumer
Caption: Garb of a traveling perfumer of no renown. The thick front apron, the badge of a perfumer, has been replaced with a more simple one made from soft leather.

Name: Depraved Perfumer Robe
Info: Robe of a depraved perfumer gripped by madness
Caption: Robe worn by depraved perfumers. The embroidery on the apron is itself a curse upon the Erdtree. These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is what earned them their name.

Name: Depraved Perfumer Robe (Altered)
Info: Tunic of a depraved perfumer gripped by madness
Caption: Robe worn by depraved perfumers. The embroidery on the apron is itself a curse upon the Erdtree. These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is what earned them their name.

Name: Upper-Class Robe
Info: Extravagantly embroidered noble's gown
Caption: Embroidered, bright green robe worn by noble children. Donning such a robe is traditionally the child's first show of burgeoning independence.

Name: Ruler's Robe
Info: Extravagantly embroidered noble's robe
Caption: Luxurious robe worn by lords in a smaller nation. Its fine blue mantle serves to prove its wearer's status.

Name: Consort's Robe
Info: Dress of Tanith, Lady of the Volcano Manor
Caption: Fine robe of white silk worn by Tanith, Lady of the Volcano Manor. Long ago, when Rykard first set eyes on Tanith, she was working as a dancer in a foreign land. Soon, he made her his consort. She was the only human to remain by his side when he became the serpent of blasphemy. In that moment, Tanith was truly charmed by him.

Name: Official's Attire
Info: Noble's gown woven with sturdy fabric
Caption: Grubby blue robe worn by magisterial officials to carry out their grim tasks. Surveillance, executions, gruesome rituals… The darkest duties drive the wheels of mankind.

Name: Marais Robe
Info: Noble's cape woven with sturdy fabric
Caption: Robe with a black mantle across the shoulders. Customarily worn by the head of House Marais. The sons of House Marais are all sickly born. Little wonder that Maleigh Marais would be so beguiled by the beautiful and fierce goddess who was born into rot.

Name: Fur Raiment
Info: Garb worn by worshippers of stag specters
Caption: Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt. Worn by ancestral follower warriors. The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

Name: Shaman Furs
Info: %null%
Caption: Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt. Worn by ancestral follower shamans. The ancestral followers live a distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

Name: Godskin Apostle Robe
Info: Robe made from tanned Demigod skin
Caption: Robe made by sewing together patches of smooth skin. Worn by the Godskin Apostles. The apostles, once said to serve Destined Death, are wielders of the god-slaying black flame. But after their defeat by Maliketh, the Black Blade, the source of their power was sealed away.

Name: Godskin Noble Robe
Info: Robe made from tanned corpulent Demigod skin
Caption: Robe made by sewing together patches of smooth skin. Subcutaneous fat makes it plump and soft. Worn by Godskin Nobles, known for their seven-face aprons. Strengthens the Noble Presence incantation. Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.

Name: Fell Omen Cloak
Info: Robe worn by Morgott, the Elden Lord
Caption: A cloak of ragged fur worn about the exposed body of Margit, the Fell Omen. Having slaughtered countless champions during the Shattering, the Fell Omen has become a horror to those who harbor ambitions for the Erdtree, or for Lordship.

Name: Sanguine Noble Robe
Info: Robe of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery
Caption: Robe of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery. Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood. The grand metallic pattern on the shoulder is a signifier of the noble rank they intend to claim upon the advent of the new dynasty they are working to install.

Name: Lord of Blood's Robe
Info: Robe of Mohg, Lord of Blood
Caption: Attire of Mohg, Lord of Blood, embroidered with an extravagant gold emblem on black cloth. The dress of a Luminary, the reigning lord and hierarch of the coming dynasty of Mohgwyn. Or perhaps, of a raving lunatic.

Name: Lord of Blood's Robe (Altered)
Info: Gown of Mohg, Lord of Blood
Caption: Attire of Mohg, Lord of Blood, embroidered with an extravagant gold emblem on black cloth. The dress of a Luminary, the reigning lord and hierarch of the coming dynasty of Mohgwyn. Or perhaps, of a raving lunatic.

Name: Leather Armor
Info: Dirty leather armor worn by bandits
Caption: Lightweight and battle-proven leather armor worn by a savvy soldier. Many admire the wearer of this armor for his chivalrous and forthright spirit.

Name: Blue Cloth Vest
Info: Vest of a nomadic warrior, made of blue cloth
Caption: Vest of a nomadic warrior. The blue color of its fabric symbolizes brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer. Just as still waters turn foul, stagnation leads to decay. Warriors must remain ever drifting.

Name: Noble's Traveling Garb
Info: Armor of expatriated royalty
Caption: Traveling attire fashioned from metallic white silk thread. Worn by expatriated royalty. A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

Name: War Surgeon Gown
Info: Old white tunic, stained with blood
Caption: Bloodstained white gown of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers. Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood. None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception.

Name: War Surgeon Gown (Altered)
Info: Physician's vest made from thick leather
Caption: Bloodstained white gown of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers. Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood. None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception.

Name: Nomadic Merchant's Finery
Info: Peddler Kalé's cloak
Caption: Finery of the nomadic merchants. Decorated with tiny gems in a wide spectrum of colors. These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground. Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.

Name: Nomadic Merchant's Finery (Altered)
Info: Peddler Kalé's vest
Caption: Finery of the nomadic merchants. Decorated with tiny gems in a wide spectrum of colors. These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground. Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.

Name: Bandit Garb
Info: Vest worn by followers of the deadly birds
Caption: Leather garb worn by bandits. Light for ease of movement, and supple for masking sound. In trade, they offer little damage negation.

Name: Confessor Armor
Info: Black robe of those who kill for a living
Caption: Black leather armor for blending in with the darkness. Worn by church confessors. The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace. The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

Name: Confessor Armor (Altered)
Info: Vest of those who kill for a living
Caption: Black leather armor for blending in with the darkness. Worn by church confessors. The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace. The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

Name: Omenkiller Robe
Info: Robe worn by Executioners
Caption: Robe worn by the Omenkillers, butchers of twisted conscience. Its thick apron is worn in remembrance of Rollo, the progenitor of the Omenkillers and a perfumer of antiquity.

Name: Raptor's Black Feathers
Info: Cloak worn by followers of the deadly birds
Caption: Robe crafted with the black feathers of a bird of prey. Worn by the assassins of Ravenmount. A ritual implement for transforming into a Deathbird, if only by imitation. Strengthens jump attacks. "We are birds of prey, bringers of death."

Name: Foot Soldier Tabard
Info: Armor used by Raya Lucaria Academy Soldiers
Caption: Padded cloth armor with more than a few stains. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

Name: Leather-Draped Tabard
Info: Armor used by Capital Soldiers
Caption: Padded cloth armor with a leather shawl draped over the shoulders. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

Name: Chain-Draped Tabard
Info: Armor used by Stormveil Soldiers
Caption: Padded cloth armor with a chainmail shawl draped over the shoulders. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

Name: Ivory-Draped Tabard
Info: Armor used by Miquella's Soldiers
Caption: Padded cloth armor with a shawl in the color of ivory draped over the shoulders. Worn by foot soldiers sworn to the Haligtree.

Name: Scarlet Tabard
Info: Armor used by Caelid Wilds Patrol Soldiers
Caption: Padded cloth armor with the telltale stains of the scarlet rot. Worn by foot soldiers in General Radahn's army.

Name: Bloodsoaked Tabard
Info: Armor used by Mausoleum Soldiers
Caption: Padded cloth armor with indelible bloodstains around the neck. Worn by headless foot soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.

Name: Highwayman Cloth Armor
Info: Robe worn by cave-dwelling foot soldiers
Caption: Hideously stained and ragged cloth armor. Worn by former foot soldiers who have turned to banditry.

Name: Vulgar Militia Armor
Info: Armor worn by wandering soldiers
Caption: Armor worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen. Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. This is where the vulgar militia serve, as untiring, unsung watchkeepers.

Name: Gravekeeper Cloak
Info: Robe made from a beast pelt
Caption: Thick, bristly cloak that is the symbol of an underground gravekeeper. Those who once fought for a living were driven from the colosseum, and becoming guardians of Erdtree Burial.

Name: Gravekeeper Cloak (Altered)
Info: Bronze bracelets adorned with snakes
Caption: Defensive wear encircled by bronze snakes. Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes. The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

Name: Rotten Gravekeeper Cloak
Info: Robe fashioned from the pelt of a deadly beast
Caption: Thick, bristly cloak eaten through by scarlet rot. The symbol of an underground gravekeeper's station.

Name: Rotten Gravekeeper Cloak (Altered)
Info: Scarlet-bronze anklet depicting coiled snakes
Caption: Cloak wrapped with bronze snakes, eaten through by scarlet rot. Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

Name: Nox Monk Armor
Info: Armor worn by members of the Empyrean family
