For our duty is to remain here, a bulwark against the blight."

Name: Gelmir Knight Armor
Info: Armor used by Capital Knights
Caption: Armor worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard. It bears an emblem that none wear any longer, standing as it does for a lord that fell from lofty ambition into gluttonous depravity. As the lord lost his dignity, so too did these knights lose their master.

Name: Gelmir Knight Armor (Altered)
Info: Armor used by Capital Knights
Caption: Armor worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard. It bears an emblem that none wear any longer, standing as it does for a lord that fell from lofty ambition into gluttonous depravity. As the lord lost his dignity, so too did these knights lose their master.

Name: Leyndell Knight Armor
Info: Armor used by Elite Capital Knights
Caption: Armor worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. Its left breast is emblazoned with a symbol of Erdtree Worship, said to have once been imbued with an incantation of protection.

Name: Leyndell Knight Armor (Altered)
Info: Armor used by Elite Capital Knights
Caption: Armor worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. Its left breast is emblazoned with a symbol of Erdtree Worship, said to have once been imbued with an incantation of protection.

Name: Haligtree Knight Armor
Info: Armor used by Elite Knights of Miquella
Caption: Armor worn by knights sworn to the Haligtree. Its left breast is emblazoned with the crest of the Haligtree. Though watered with Miquella's own blood since it was a sapling, the Haligtree ultimately failed to grow into an Erdtree.

Name: Haligtree Knight Armor (Altered)
Info: Armor used by Elite Knights of Miquella
Caption: Armor worn by knights sworn to the Haligtree. Its left breast is emblazoned with the crest of the Haligtree. Though watered with Miquella's own blood since it was a sapling, the Haligtree ultimately failed to grow into an Erdtree.

Name: Mausoleum Knight Armor
Info: Armor used by Elite Mausoleum Knights
Caption: Armor worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. The wing-shaped ornaments on its back evoke the Deathbird. A self-inflicted curse that ties the spirits of these loyal knights to the land, having willingly beheaded themselves so that they may serve their masters in death.

Name: Mausoleum Knight Armor (Altered)
Info: Armor used by Elite Mausoleum Knights
Caption: Armor worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. The wing-shaped ornaments on its back evoke the Deathbird. A self-inflicted curse that ties the spirits of these loyal knights to the land, having willingly beheaded themselves so that they may serve their masters in death.

Name: Bloodhound Knight Armor
Info: Beast-like armor of the Bloodhound Knights
Caption: Metal armor with a jutting breastplate. Worn by the Bloodhound Knights. The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers. Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master. Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

Name: Bloodhound Knight Armor (Altered)
Info: Beast-like armor of the Bloodhound Knights
Caption: Metal armor with a jutting breastplate. Worn by the Bloodhound Knights. The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers. Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master. Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

Name: Cleanrot Armor
Info: Armor of a Wing Knight. Somewhat decayed...
Caption: Armor of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering. The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.

Name: Cleanrot Armor (Altered)
Info: Armor of a Wing Knight. Somewhat decayed…
Caption: Armor of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering. The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.

Name: Raging Wolf Armor
Info: Armor of Vargram the Bloody Wolf
Caption: Armor worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold. According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean, and this is what Vargram aspired to be.

Name: Raging Wolf Armor (Altered)
Info: Breastplate of Vargram the Bloody Wolf
Caption: Armor worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold. According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean, and this is what Vargram aspired to be.

Name: Hoslow's Armor
Info: Armor passed down through the Hoslow family
Caption: Garish silver armor decorated with red embellishments. Passed down through the Hoslow family. When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused. "I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion."

Name: Hoslow's Armor (Altered)
Info: Armor passed down through the Hoslow family
Caption: Garish silver armor decorated with red embellishments. Passed down through the Hoslow family. When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused. "I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion."

Name: Twinned Armor
Info: Armor worn by D, Knight of the Golden Order
Caption: Armor depicting entwined twins of gold and silver. The two known as D are inseparable twins. They are of two bodies and two minds, but one single soul. Not once do they stand together; not one word do they speak to one another. Perhaps this armor longs to find its way to the other D.

Name: Twinned Armor (Altered)
Info: Armor worn by D, Knight of the Golden Order
Caption: Armor depicting entwined twins of gold and silver. The two known as D are inseparable twins. They are of two bodies and two minds, but one single soul. Not once do they stand together; not one word do they speak to one another. Perhaps this armor longs to find its way to the other D.

Name: Drake Knight Armor
Info: Malformed armor fused with dragon flesh
Caption: Black iron armor worn by drake knights. Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion. The cape is crafted with dragon wing membrane.

Name: Drake Knight Armor (Altered)
Info: Malformed armor fused with dragon flesh
Caption: Black iron armor worn by drake knights. Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion. From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe.

Name: Blaidd's Armor
Info: Armor of Blaidd, Knight of Ranni
Caption: Well-worn black armor of the man-wolf Blaidd. The pelt serves as a cape, protecting from cold. Blaidd was the blade of Ranni, but the cold bothered him anyway.

Name: Blaidd's Armor (Altered)
Info: Armor of Blaidd, Knight of Ranni
Caption: Well-worn black armor of the man-wolf Blaidd. Blaidd, who served as Ranni's shadow, was a loyal ally who would defy destiny itself if it would have him turn upon his Lady.

Name: Briar Armor
Info: Armor worn by Condor Knights
Caption: Battered iron armor from a foreign land. Worn by Elemer of the Briar. The winding, rusted iron briars are a mark of the guilty, and typically indicate a sentence of death. Elemer murdered numerous instructors and merchants, and was known as the Bell Bearing Hunter.

Name: Briar Armor (Altered)
Info: Armor worn by Condor Knights
Caption: Battered iron armor from a foreign land. Worn by Elemer of the Briar. The winding, rusted iron briars are a mark of the guilty, and typically indicate a sentence of death. Elemer murdered numerous instructors and merchants, and was known as the Bell Bearing Hunter.

Name: Fingerprint Armor
Info: Deformed armor of a mad knight in despair
Caption: Iron armor singed and blistered by fingers. Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold. No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy. Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?

Name: Fingerprint Armor (Altered)
Info: Deformed armor of a mad knight in despair
Caption: Iron armor singed and blistered by fingers. Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold. No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy. Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?

Name: Royal Remains Armor
Info: Armor that mediates via body of famed ancestor
Caption: Armor graced with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing. Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced. It is said that the bones belong to an ancient lord―the soulless king. The lord of the lost and desperate, who was known as Ensha.

Name: All-Knowing Armor
Info: Armor of Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing
Caption: Armor set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. At the end that should not be.

Name: All-Knowing Armor (Altered)
Info: Armor of Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing
Caption: Armor set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. At the end that should not be.

Name: Royal Knight Armor
Info: Armor of an Arbor Sentinel
Caption: Silver armor of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree. Loretta was once a royal Carian knight, and her lapis-lazuli blue cape is the emblem of the knightly pride that continues to guide her.

Name: Royal Knight Armor (Altered)
Info: Armor of an Arbor Sentinel
Caption: Silver armor of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree. Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

Name: Maliketh's Armor
Info: Armor of Maliketh the Black Blade
Caption: Beast's armor made of black iron and decorated with gold. Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade. Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him. Champions knew what was at stake. Indeed, that is what made them champions.

Name: Maliketh's Armor (Altered)
Info: Armor of Maliketh the Black Blade
Caption: Beast's armor made of black iron and decorated with gold. Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade. Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him. Champions knew what was at stake. Indeed, that is what made them champions.

Name: Banished Knight Armor
Info: Knight's armor, worn by salt winds and battle
Caption: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. This armor was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

Name: Banished Knight Armor (Altered)
Info: Armor of a Stormveil Knight
Caption: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. This armor was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

Name: Night's Cavalry Armor
Info: Armor covered in blackened bloodstains
Caption: Pitch-black armor thinly painted with dried blood. Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds. The Night's Cavalry, who now wander the dim roads of night, were once led by the Fell Omen and were deliverers of death for great warriors, knights, and champions.

Name: Night's Cavalry Armor (Altered)
Info: Armor covered in blackened bloodstains
Caption: Pitch-black armor thinly painted with dried blood. Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds. The Night's Cavalry, who now wander the dim roads of night, were once led by the Fell Omen and were deliverers of death for great warriors, knights, and champions.

Name: Veteran's Armor
Info: Veteran General's old armor
Caption: Old armor that has seen many battles. Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol. Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master. This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

Name: Veteran's Armor (Altered)
Info: Veteran General's old armor
Caption: Old armor that has seen many battles. Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol. Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master. This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

Name: Scaled Armor
Info: Armor made from layered ancient dragon scales
Caption: Armor worn by Old Knight Istvan. The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it highly effective against non-physical attacks. Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survive to this day.

Name: Scaled Armor (Altered)
Info: Armor made of layered ancient dragon scales
Caption: Armor worn by Old Knight Istvan. The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it highly effective against non-physical attacks. Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survive to this day.

Name: Beast Champion Armor
Info: Armor of Belnahr the Traitor
Caption: Silver armor engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant. Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was. Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

Name: Beast Champion Armor (Altered)
Info: Armor of Belnahr the Traitor
Caption: Silver armor engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant. Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was. Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

Name: Tree Sentinel Armor
Info: Armor of a Tree Sentinel
Caption: Golden armor of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree. Adorned with a cape featuring the mark of the sacred tree. Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.

Name: Tree Sentinel Armor (Altered)
Info: Armor of a Tree Sentinel
Caption: Golden armor of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree. Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.

Name: Malformed Dragon Armor
Info: Malformed, golden armor used by Gnarrl
Caption: Malformed golden armor. Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels. After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.

Name: Crucible Axe Armor
Info: Armor used by Ordovis of the Crucible and his men
Caption: Armor of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. Worn by the knight Ordovis and his men. Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

Name: Crucible Axe Armor (Altered)
Info: Armor used by Ordovis of the Crucible and his men
Caption: Armor of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. Worn by the knight Ordovis and his men. Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

Name: Crucible Tree Armor
Info: Armor used by Siluria of the Crucible and her men
Caption: Armor of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. Worn by the knight Siluria and her men. Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

Name: Crucible Tree Armor (Altered)
Info: Armor used by Siluria of the Crucible and her men
Caption: Armor of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. Worn by the knight Siluria and her men. Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

Name: Radahn's Lion Armor
Info: Armor of Radahn, God of War
Caption: Armor depicting the golden lion. Worn by General Radahn. The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.

Name: Radahn's Lion Armor (Altered)
Info: Armor of Radahn, God of War
Caption: Armor depicting the golden lion. Worn by General Radahn. The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.

Name: Lionel's Armor
Info: Oddly shaped armor used by foreign knights
Caption: Round iron armor with a banner extending from its back. Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted. When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.

Name: Lionel's Armor (Altered)
Info: Oddly shaped armor used by foreign knights
Caption: Round iron armor. Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted. When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.

Name: Bull-Goat Armor
Info: Great Horned Tragoth's armor
Caption: Great Horned Tragoth's armor. Covers its wearer with a pair of giant horns, providing staunch poise. Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.

Name: Omen Armor
Info: Armor of a curse gnawed Omen
Caption: Malformed armor resembling an Omen with its horns cut off. Worn by the Dung Eater. The heavy, sun-shaped medallion represents both the guidance he once saw, and the ring to which it will one day lead.

Name: Fire Prelate Armor
Info: Fire Prelate armor adorned with a red cloth
Caption: Black iron armor adorned with a red cloth. Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks. The weighty frames of the Prelates symbolized the onus of their grave vows as guardians of the flame. "Etch this sight upon thine breast. Of my thunderous gravity."

Name: Fire Prelate Armor (Altered)
Info: Fire Prelate armor adorned with a red cloth
Caption: Black iron armor. Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks. The weighty frames of the Prelates symbolized the onus of their grave vows as guardians of the flame. "Etch this sight upon thine breast. Of my thunderous gravity."

Name: Ragged Armor
Info: Armor pieced together from scavenged metal
Caption: Armor pieced together from scavenged metal.

Name: Ragged Armor (Altered)
Info: Armor pieced together from scavenged metal
Caption: Armor pieced together from scavenged metal.

Name: Brave's Battlewear
Info: Battlewear of a warrior of the frigid uplands
Caption: Battlewear fashioned from leather armor adorned with a large sheet of cloth. Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands. The red cloth signifies participation in the Long March long, long ago and this ceremonial garb beseeches the favor of the Warrior King who led them.

Name: Brave's Battlewear (Altered)
Info: Battlewear of a warrior of the frigid uplands
Caption: Helm wrapped in thick leather. Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

Name: Millicent's Robe
Info: Robe worn by Millicent the Rotting
Caption: Robe worn by Millicent the Rotting

Name: Millicent's Tunic
Info: Tunic worn by Millicent the Rotting
Caption: Tunic worn by Millicent the Rotting

Name: Traveler's Manchettes
Info: Arm wraps worn by Malenia
Caption: Light yet sturdy leather manchettes. Worn by young women who set off into the world to confront their fate.

Name: Guardian Bracers
Info: Gauntlets worn by the people of rotted abundance
Caption: Engraved golden bracers. Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees. In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.

Name: Bloodsoaked Manchettes
Info: Noble's waistcloth woven with sturdy fabric
Caption: Manchettes formed from tightly-wound bandages soaked through with blood. Any protection is welcome for the festering arms beneath.

Name: Mushroom Arms
Info: Arm wraps with slime mold growing on them
Caption: Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushrooms have colonized the arms. To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.

Name: Astrologer Gloves
Info: Gloves of the glintstone polishers
Caption: Gloves fashioned from fine, supple cloth. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above. They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers. But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

Name: Sorcerer Manchettes
Info: Manchettes worn by Raya Lucaria's magic scholars
Caption: Manchettes worn by Raya Lucaria's scholars of sorcery. Made by wrapping a simple cloth around the forearms.

Name: Battlemage Manchettes
Info: Arm wraps of an unaffiliated glintstone sorcerer
Caption: Manchettes worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.

Name: Errant Sorcerer Manchettes
Info: Arm wraps worn by a great sorcerer turned hermit
Caption: Commonplace leather manchettes. Their hands are inlaid with dulled glintstone.

Name: Spellblade's Gloves
Info: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's gloves
Caption: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's gloves, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthen glintstone sorcery skills. Rogier spent his entire life behaving with utter detachment. No one noticed the anger, grief, regret, or fear that existed along with it.

Name: Alberich's Bracers
Info: Gloves of a defected glintstone sorcerer
Caption: Mad Tongue Alberich's bracers. Set with red glintstones, said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthen thorn sorcery. Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

Name: Preceptor's Gloves
Info: Gloves worn by ruthless Chaplains
Caption: Gloves of the magic preceptors who serve the Carian royals. Black and perfectly discreet.

Name: Azur's Manchettes
Info: Blue transparent arm wraps of a Crystal Sorcerer
Caption: Manchettes corroded by blue-green glintstones. Worn by Azur, primeval current sorcerer. Azur had reached a near-inorganic state.

Name: Lusat's Manchettes
Info: Dull red arm wraps of a Crystal Sorcerer
Caption: Manchettes corroded by blue glintstones. Worn by Lusat, primeval current sorcerer. Lusat had reached a near-inorganic state.

Name: Queen's Bracelets
Info: Bracelet of Rennala, the Full Moon Witch
Caption: Bracelets indicating the highest order of sorcerer. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him. And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

Name: Traveling Maiden Gloves
Info: Gloves worn by traveling clerics
Caption: Gloves worn by traveling maidens. Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.

Name: Gold Bracelets
Info: Arm wraps worn by researchers of the Golden Order
Caption: Bracelets made in the image of Erdtree branches. Minimal adornments made by Lord Goldmask's disciples. Those disciples have long since left him.

Name: Perfumer Gloves
Info: Gloves of an Erdtree Capital perfumer
Caption: Gloves of an Erdtree Capital perfumer. In times past, the role of perfumer was much respected; a blessed apothecary in the eyes of the many. But after entering the battlefields of the Shattering they performed no such role, trading their aromatics for poisons and explosives.

Name: Traveler's Gloves
Info: Gloves of an unaffiliated perfumer
Caption: Gloves of a traveling perfumer of no renown. An associate of a healer, he is said to be in search of new aromatics and flower gardens, in hopes of treating Misbegotten, Omen, and all those seen as impure.

Name: Depraved Perfumer Gloves
Info: Gloves of a depraved perfumer gripped by madness
Caption: Gloves worn by depraved perfumers. These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is what earned them their name.

Name: Godskin Apostle Bracelets
Info: Bracelets made from tanned Demigod skin
Caption: Black bracelets of the Godskin Apostles. The apostles, once said to serve Destined Death, are wielders of the god-slaying black flame. But after their defeat by Maliketh, the Black Blade, the source of their power was sealed away.

Name: Godskin Noble Bracelets
Info: Bracelets made from tanned corpulent Demigod skin
Caption: Black bracelets of the Godskin Nobles. Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.

Name: Leather Gloves
Info: Dirty gloves worn by bandits
Caption: Lightweight and battle-proven leather gloves worn by a savvy soldier. Many admire the wearer of this armor for his chivalrous and forthright spirit.

Name: Warrior Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets of a nomadic warrior
Caption: Gauntlets of a nomadic warrior. Crafted from sturdy leather.

Name: Noble's Gloves
Info: Gloves of expatriated royalty
Caption: Gloves of plush leather. Worn by expatriated royalty. A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

Name: War Surgeon Gloves
Info: Physician's gloves made from thick leather
Caption: Bloodstained white gloves of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers. Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood. None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception.

Name: Bandit Manchettes
Info: Wraps worn by followers of the deadly birds
Caption: Manchettes made by simply wrapping dirty cloth around the arms. Worn by bandits.

Name: Confessor Gloves
Info: Gloves of those who kill for a living
Caption: Black leather gloves of the church confessors. The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace. The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

Name: Omenkiller Long Gloves
Info: Gloves worn by Executioners
Caption: Long, stiff leather gloves worn by the Omenkillers.

Name: Foot Soldier Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets used by Stormveil Soldiers
Caption: Metal gauntlets covered in nicks and dents. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

Name: Highwayman Gauntlets
Info: Gloves worn by cave-dwelling foot soldiers
Caption: Hideously stained and dented gauntlets. Worn by former foot soldiers who have turned to banditry.

Name: Vulgar Militia Gauntlets
Info: Gloves worn by wandering soldiers
Caption: Gauntlets worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen. Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. This is where the vulgar militia serve, as untiring, unsung watchkeepers.

Name: Nox Monk Bracelets
Info: Bracelets worn by members of the Empyrean family
Caption: Bracelets worn by the monks of the Eternal City. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

Name: Champion Bracers
Info: Gauntlets reserved for the badlands' bravest
Caption: Bracers reserved for the badlands' bravest. Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes. Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

Name: Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets worn by ordinary soldiers.
Caption: Gauntlets worn by ordinary soldiers. Though plain in appearance, they offer dependable protection.

Name: Iron Gauntlets
Info: Ordinary iron gauntlets
Caption: Ordinary iron gauntlets.

Name: Godrick Soldier Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets used by Stormveil Knights
Caption: Gauntlets worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Name: Raya Lucarian Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets used by Raya Lucaria Academy Knights
Caption: Gauntlets worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Name: Radahn Soldier Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets used by Caelid Wilds Knights
Caption: Gauntlets worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Name: Leyndell Soldier Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets used by Capital Knights
Caption: Gauntlets worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Name: Haligtree Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets used by Knights of Miquella
Caption: Gauntlets worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Name: Mausoleum Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets used by Mausoleum Knights
Caption: Gauntlets worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Name: Exile Gauntlets
Info: Iron gauntlets worn by salt winds and battle
Caption: Damaged iron gauntlets. Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.

Name: Kaiden Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets worn by Kaiden sellswords
Caption: Gauntlets worn by Kaiden sellswords. These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback. Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

Name: Land of Reeds Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets of a warrior from the land of reeds
Caption: Gauntlets wrapped in tough leather. Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds.

Name: White Reed Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets of a land of reeds veteran warrior
Caption: Gauntlets of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates. Worn by the Inaba, head disciples of the great swordsman Okina. The Inaba traveled in pursuit of not only the master who abandoned them, but also proper deaths, won honorably through hard-fought combat. To be a White Reed is to seek death; fitting for the Inaba, who desired nothing more than to die by the sword.

Name: Ronin's Gauntlets
Info: Bloody Finger Hunter Yura's gauntlets
Caption: Gauntlets of the man who calls himself Shabriri. Highly functional and heavily worn. The man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart.

Name: Eccentric's Manchettes
Info: Deathwatch, Jerren's gauntlets
Caption: The knight Jerren's manchettes. Jerren preferred a nomadic existence, but after spending time as a guest of the Carian royals, he became the guest commander for General Radahn. And for the first time, the restless tumbleweed would be bound by honorable oath.

Name: Blue Silver Bracelets
Info: Bracelets made of motherly silver
Caption: Bracelets crafted with blue silver. Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers. Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.

Name: Fire Monk Gauntlets
Info: Fire Monk gauntlets which resemble flames
Caption: Black iron gauntlets featuring a flame motif. Attire of the Fire Monks. The Fire Monks are guardians of the flame of ruin, forbidden by the Erdtree and said to be kept high in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

Name: Blackflame Monk Gauntlets
Info: Godskin Monk gauntlets which resemble flames
Caption: Black iron gauntlets featuring a flame motif. Attire of the Blackflame Monks. The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

Name: Zamor Bracelets
Info: Arm wraps worn by an ancient hero
Caption: Bracelets worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants. These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

Name: Black Knife Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets used by the Black Blade Assassins
Caption: Gauntlets used by the Black Knife Assassins. Crafted with scale armor that makes no sound. The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

Name: Malenia's Gauntlet
Info: Gauntlets of Arbitress Malenia
Caption: Gauntlet made of unalloyed gold. Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella. Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk. "My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god—he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."

Name: Elden Lord Bracers
Info: Gauntlets of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord
Caption: Bracers of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield. He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

Name: Knight Gauntlets
Info: Iron gauntlets worn by foreign knights
Caption: Iron gauntlets of an unknown knight. It is made of thin iron plate. Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.

Name: Vagabond Knight Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets of a banished knight
Caption: Gauntlets of a knight banished from their motherland. Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey. Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

Name: Carian Knight Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets of enchanted Carian knights
Caption: Gauntlets of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family. The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were all heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

Name: Godrick Knight Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets used by Stormveil Elite Knights
Caption: Gauntlets worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted. Time has yet to dull their luster.

Name: Cuckoo Knight Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets of Raya Lucaria Academy Elite Knights
Caption: Gauntlets worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights. Time has yet to dull their luster.

Name: Redmane Knight Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets used by Elite Caelid Wilds Knights
Caption: Black iron gauntlets worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side. Time has yet to dull their luster.

Name: Gelmir Knight Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets used by Capital Knights
Caption: Gauntlets worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard. Time has yet to dull their luster.

Name: Leyndell Knight Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets used by Elite Capital Knights
Caption: Gauntlets worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. Time has yet to dull their luster.

Name: Haligtree Knight Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets used by Elite Knights of Miquella
Caption: Gauntlets worn by knights sworn to the Haligtree. Time has yet to dull their luster.

Name: Mausoleum Knight Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets used by Elite Mausoleum Knights
Caption: Gauntlets worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. Time has yet to dull their luster.

Name: Bloodhound Knight Gauntlets
Info: Beast-like gauntlets of the Bloodhound Knights
Caption: Metal gauntlets of the Bloodhound Knights. The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers. Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master. Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

Name: Cleanrot Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets of a Wing Knight. Somewhat decayed...
Caption: Gauntlets of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering. The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.

Name: Raging Wolf Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets of Vargram the Bloody Wolf
Caption: Gauntlets worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold. According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean, and this is what Vargram aspired to be.

Name: Hoslow's Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets passed down through the Hoslow family
Caption: Garish silver gauntlets decorated with red embellishments. Passed down through the Hoslow family. When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused. "I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion."

Name: Twinned Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets worn by D, Knight of the Golden Order
Caption: Gauntlets depicting entwined twins of gold and silver. The two known as D are inseparable twins. They are of two bodies and two minds, but one single soul. Not once do they stand together; not one word do they speak to one another. Perhaps this armor longs to find its way to the other D.

Name: Drake Knight Gauntlets
Info: Malformed gauntlets fused with dragon flesh
Caption: Black iron gauntlets worn by drake knights. Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion. From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe.

Name: Blaidd's Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets of Blaidd, Knight of Ranni
Caption: Well-worn black gauntlets of the man-wolf Blaidd. Blaidd, who served as Ranni's shadow, was a loyal ally who would defy destiny itself if it would have him turn upon his Lady.

Name: Briar Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets worn by Condor Knights
Caption: Battered gauntlets from a foreign land. Worn by Elemer of the Briar. The winding, rusted iron briars are a mark of the guilty, and typically indicate a sentence of death. Elemer murdered numerous instructors and merchants, and was known as the Bell Bearing Hunter.

Name: Fingerprint Gauntlets
Info: Deformed gauntlets of a mad knight in despair
Caption: Iron gauntlets singed and blistered by fingers. Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold. No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy. Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?

Name: Royal Remains Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets that mediate via body of famed ancestor
Caption: Gauntlets graced with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing. Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced. It is said that the bones belong to an ancient lord―the soulless king. The lord of the lost and desperate, who was known as Ensha.

Name: All-Knowing Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets of Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing
Caption: Gauntlets set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. At the end that should not be.

Name: Royal Knight Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets of an Arbor Sentinel
Caption: Silver gauntlets of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree. Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

Name: Maliketh's Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets of Maliketh the Black Blade
Caption: Beast's gauntlets made of black iron and decorated with gold. Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade. Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him. Champions knew what was at stake. Indeed, that is what made them champions.

Name: Banished Knight Gauntlets
Info: Knight's gauntlets, worn by salt winds and battle
Caption: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. These gauntlets were worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

Name: Night's Cavalry Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets covered in blackened bloodstains
Caption: Pitch-black gauntlets thinly painted with dried blood. Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds. The Night's Cavalry, who now wander the dim roads of night, were once led by the Fell Omen and were deliverers of death for great warriors, knights, and champions.

Name: Veteran's Gauntlets
Info: Veteran General's old gauntlets
Caption: Old gauntlets that have seen many battles. Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol. Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master. This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

Name: Scaled Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets made from layered ancient dragon scales
Caption: Gauntlets worn by Old Knight Istvan. The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it highly effective against non-physical attacks. Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survive to this day.

Name: Beast Champion Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets of Belnahr the Traitor
Caption: Silver gauntlets engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant. Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was. Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

Name: Tree Sentinel Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets of a Tree Sentinel
Caption: Golden gauntlets of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree. Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.

Name: Malformed Dragon Gauntlets
Info: Malformed, golden gauntlets used by Gnarrl
Caption: Malformed golden gauntlets. Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels. After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.

Name: Crucible Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets used by the Crucible Knights
Caption: Gauntlets of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. Hold the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthen Aspects of the Crucible incantations. In time, the strength shown by these knights, and even their appearance, was seen as chaotic and deserving of scorn.

Name: Radahn's Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets of Radahn, God of War
Caption: Gauntlets depicting the golden lion. Worn by General Radahn. The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.

Name: Lionel's Gauntlets
Info: Oddly shaped gauntlets used by foreign knights
Caption: Rounded iron gauntlets. Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted. When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.

Name: Bull-Goat Gauntlets
Info: Great Horned Tragoth's gauntlets
Caption: Great Horned Tragoth's gauntlets, adorned with a gold bull-goat motif. Provide high poise. Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.

Name: Omen Gauntlets
Info: Gauntlets of a curse gnawed Omen
Caption: Malformed gauntlets resembling an Omen with its horns cut off. Worn by the Dung Eater, their form is a vision of the landscape of his mind, and of his appearance as he wished to see it. The heart of an Omen without the body to match; could there be any crueler existence? What does it matter, then, if the curse claims it all?

Name: Fire Prelate Gauntlets
Info: Fire Prelate gauntlets which resemble flames
Caption: Black iron gauntlets with the appearance of flames. Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks. The weighty frames of the Prelates symbolized the onus of their grave vows as guardians of the flame. "Etch this sight upon thine breast. Of my thunderous gravity."

Name: Ragged Gloves
Info: Gauntlets pieced together from scavenged metal
Caption: Gauntlets pieced together from scavenged metal.

Name: Brave's Bracer
Info: Gauntlets of a warrior of the frigid uplands
Caption: Gauntlets wrapped in thick leather. Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands. Has a fur lining which excels at keeping the cold at bay.

Name: Millicent's Gloves
Info: Gloves worn by Millicent the Rotting
Caption: Gloves worn by Millicent the Rotting

Name: Golden Prosthetic
Info: Golden prosthetic forged using ancient techniques
Caption: Golden prosthetic forged using ancient techniques

Name: Cloth Trousers
Info: Trousers made of rough material
Caption: Trousers made of coarse material, commonly worn in the Lands Between.

Name: Traveler's Boots
Info: Skirt worn by Malenia
Caption: Light yet sturdy leather boots. Worn by young women who set off into the world to confront their fate.

Name: Commoner's Shoes
Info: Waistcloth of a rune cursed citizen
Caption: Modest shoes made of cloth. Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between. Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.

Name: Aristocrat Boots
Info: Aristocrat boots, made of thick leather
Caption: Boots made from tanned leather. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Name: Old Aristocrat Shoes
Info: Aristocrat shoes made from sturdy leather
Caption: Hard-wearing shoes made of leather. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Name: Page Trousers
Info: Trousers worn by pages
Caption: Trousers worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way. Traveling wear tailored with exquisite precision, to avoid any undue shame for the page's master.

Name: Guardian Greaves
Info: Greaves worn by the people of rotted abundance
Caption: Engraved golden greaves. Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees. In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.

Name: Prisoner Trousers
Info: Tattered trousers
Caption: Tattered trousers. Worn by a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime. Never once washed, every fiber is filthy. The smell is beyond belief.

Name: Mushroom Legs
Info: Leg wraps with slime mold growing on it
Caption: Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushrooms have colonized the legs. To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.

Name: Astrologer Trousers
Info: Trousers of the glintstone polishers
Caption: Trousers worn inside a robe. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above. They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers. But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

Name: Sorcerer Leggings
Info: Leggings worn by Raya Lucaria's magic scholars
Caption: Leggings worn by Raya Lucaria's scholars of sorcery. Made by wrapping a simple cloth around the legs.

Name: Battlemage Legwraps
Info: Waistcloth of an unaffiliated glintstone sorcerer
Caption: Legwraps worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.

Name: Errant Sorcerer Boots
Info: Shoes worn by a great sorcerer turned hermit
Caption: Commonplace leather boots, sturdy enough to withstand a long journey.

Name: Spellblade's Trousers
Info: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's Trousers
Caption: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's trousers, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthen glintstone sorcery skills. Rogier spent his entire life behaving with utter detachment. No one noticed the anger, grief, regret, or fear that existed along with it.

Name: Alberich's Trousers
Info: Boots of a defected glintstone sorcerer
Caption: Mad Tongue Alberich's trousers. Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

Name: Preceptor's Trousers
Info: Boots worn by ruthless Chaplains
Caption: Trousers of the magic preceptors who serve the Carian royals. Black and perfectly discreet.

Name: Old Sorcerer's Legwraps
Info: Dull red waistcloth of a Crystal Sorcerer
Caption: Ragged waistcloth that extends to the thighs. Common amongst old-fashioned sorcerers.

Name: Queen's Leggings
Info: Trousers of Rennala, the Full Moon Witch
Caption: Leggings indicating the highest order of sorcerer. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him. And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

Name: Snow Witch Skirt
Info: Skirt worn by Enchantress Ranni
Caption: Witch's skirt in the color of snow. Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries. It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her. That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.

Name: Prophet Trousers
Info: Trousers of the exiled prophets
Caption: Trousers of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune—and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result. Made from rough fabric that scrapes against the skin like a sharpening file.

Name: Traveling Maiden Boots
Info: Skirt worn by traveling clerics
Caption: Boots worn by traveling maidens. Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.

Name: Finger Maiden Shoes
Info: Skirt worn by Saints
Caption: Shoes worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers. The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers. The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.

Name: Sage Trousers
Info: Waistcloth of travelling musician gripped by death
Caption: Thick burgundy trousers. Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical. Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

Name: Gold Waistwrap
Info: Waistcloth worn by researchers of the Golden Order
Caption: Waistwrap made in the image of Erdtree branches. A minimal adornment made by Lord Goldmask's disciples. Those disciples have long since left him.

Name: Perfumer Sarong
Info: Sarong of an Erdtree Capital perfumer
Caption: Sarong of an Erdtree Capital perfumer. In times past, the role of perfumer was much respected; a blessed apothecary in the eyes of the many. But after entering the battlefields of the Shattering they performed no such role, trading their aromatics for poisons and explosives.

Name: Traveler's Slops
Info: Trousers of an unaffiliated perfumer
Caption: Slops of a traveling perfumer of no renown. An associate of a healer, he is said to be in search of new aromatics and flower gardens, in hopes of treating Misbegotten, Omen, and all those seen as impure.

Name: Depraved Perfumer Trousers
Info: Boots of a depraved perfumer gripped by madness
Caption: Trousers worn by depraved perfumers. These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is what earned them their name.

Name: Consort's Trousers
Info: Skirt of Tanith, Lady of the Volcano Manor
Caption: Fine white trousers, perfectly suited for wearing beneath a silk robe.

Name: Fur Leggings
Info: Leggings worn by worshippers of stag specters
Caption: Leggings fashioned from bristly pelts. Worn by ancestral follower warriors. The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

Name: Shaman Leggings
Info: %null%
Caption: Leggings fashioned from bristly pelts. Worn by ancestral follower shamans. The ancestral followers live a distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

Name: Godskin Apostle Trousers
Info: Boots made from tanned Demigod skin
Caption: Trousers made by sewing together patches of smooth skin. Worn by the Godskin Apostles. The apostles, once said to serve Destined Death, are wielders of the god-slaying black flame. But after their defeat by Maliketh, the Black Blade, the source of their power was sealed away.

Name: Godskin Noble Trousers
Info: Boots made from tanned corpulent Demigod skin
Caption: Trousers made by sewing together patches of smooth skin. Subcutaneous fat makes them plump and soft. Worn by Godskin Nobles. Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.

Name: Sanguine Noble Waistcloth
Info: Waistcloth of dyed black material
Caption: Waistcloth sewn from black cloth. Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood. Known to strike from pools of blood, these assassins are missionaries come to share the gospel of accursed blood.

Name: Leather Trousers
Info: Well-made leather trousers
Caption: Well-made leather trousers. The lower legs are each bound in cord for ease of movement.

Name: Leather Boots
Info: Dirty boots worn by bandits
Caption: Lightweight and battle-proven leather boots worn by a savvy soldier. Many admire the wearer of this armor for his chivalrous and forthright spirit.

Name: Warrior Greaves
Info: Greaves of a nomadic warrior
Caption: Greaves of a nomadic warrior. Crafted from sturdy leather.

Name: Noble's Trousers
Info: Trousers of expatriated royalty
Caption: White trousers of superior craftsmanship. Worn by expatriated royalty. A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

Name: War Surgeon Trousers
Info: Physician's trousers made from thick leather
Caption: Bloodstained trousers of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers. Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood. None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception.

Name: Nomadic Merchant's Trousers
Info: Peddler Kalé's trousers
Caption: Trousers of the nomadic merchants. These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground. Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.

Name: Bandit Boots
Info: Trousers worn by followers of the deadly birds
Caption: Leather boots worn by bandits. Light for ease of movement, and supple for masking sound. In trade, they offer little damage negation.

Name: Confessor Boots
Info: Boots of those who kill for a living
Caption: Leather boots of the church confessors. The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace. The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

Name: Omenkiller Boots
Info: Boots worn by Executioners
Caption: Stiff leather boots worn by the Omenkillers.

Name: Foot Soldier Greaves
Info: Greaves used by Stormveil Soldiers
Caption: Metal greaves that have already been mended countless times. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

Name: Vulgar Militia Greaves
Info: Boots worn by wandering soldiers
Caption: Greaves worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen. Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. This is where the vulgar militia serve, as untiring, unsung watchkeepers.

Name: Duelist Greaves
Info: Bronze anklets adorned with snakes
Caption: Greaves encircled by bronze snakes. Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes. The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

Name: Rotten Duelist Greaves
Info: Scarlet-bronze bracelet depicting coiled snakes
Caption: Greaves wrapped with bronze snakes, eaten through by scarlet rot. Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

Name: Nox Monk Greaves
Info: Waistcloth worn by members of the Empyrean family
Caption: Greaves worn by the monks of the Eternal City. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

Name: Champion Gaiters
Info: Gaiters formed only of leather straps
Caption: Gaiters formed only with leather straps. Common wear in the badlands.

Name: Chain Leggings
Info: Greaves made of woven chain
Caption: Leggings made of woven chain. Standard issue for ordinary soldiers. Though plain in appearance, they offer dependable protection.

Name: Godrick Soldier Greaves
Info: Greaves used by Stormveil Knights
Caption: Greaves worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Name: Raya Lucarian Greaves
Info: Greaves used by Raya Lucaria Academy Knights
Caption: Greaves worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Name: Radahn Soldier Greaves
Info: Greaves used by Caelid Wilds Knights
Caption: Greaves worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Name: Leyndell Soldier Greaves
Info: Greaves used by Capital Knights
Caption: Greaves worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Name: Haligtree Greaves
Info: Greaves used by Knights of Miquella
Caption: Greaves worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Name: Mausoleum Greaves
Info: Greaves used by Mausoleum Knights
Caption: Greaves worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Name: Exile Greaves
Info: Iron greaves worn by salt winds and battle
Caption: Damaged iron greaves. Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.

Name: Kaiden Trousers
Info: Trousers worn by Kaiden sellswords
Caption: Trousers worn by Kaiden sellswords. These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback. Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

Name: Land of Reeds Greaves
Info: Greaves of a warrior from the land of reeds
Caption: Greaves wrapped in tough leather. Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds.

Name: White Reed Greaves
Info: Greaves of a land of reeds veteran warrior
Caption: Greaves of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates. Worn by the Inaba, head disciples of the great swordsman Okina. The Inaba traveled in pursuit of not only the master who abandoned them, but also proper deaths, won honorably through hard-fought combat. To be a White Reed is to seek death; fitting for the Inaba, who desired nothing more than to die by the sword.

Name: Ronin's Greaves
Info: Bloody Finger Hunter Yura's greaves
Caption: Greaves of the man who calls himself Shabriri. Highly functional and heavily worn. The man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart.

Name: Eccentric's Breeches
Info: Deathwatch, Jerren's tights
Caption: The knight Jerren's breeches. Jerren preferred a nomadic existence, but after spending time as a guest of the Carian royals, he became the guest commander for General Radahn. And for the first time, the restless tumbleweed would be bound by honorable oath.

Name: Blue Silver Mail Skirt
Info: Chainmail skirt made of motherly silver
Caption: Chainmail skirt crafted with blue silver. Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers. Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.

Name: Fire Monk Greaves
Info: Fire Monk greaves which resemble flames
Caption: Black iron greaves featuring a flame motif. Attire of the Fire Monks. The Fire Monks are guardians of the flame of ruin, forbidden by the Erdtree and said to be kept high in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

Name: Blackflame Monk Greaves
Info: Godskin Monk greaves which resemble flames
Caption: Black iron greaves featuring a flame motif. Attire of the Blackflame Monks. The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

Name: Zamor Legwraps
Info: Waistcloth worn by an ancient hero
Caption: Legwraps worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants. These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

Name: Black Knife Greaves
Info: Greaves used by the Black Blade Assassins
Caption: Greaves used by the Black Knife Assassins. Crafted with scale armor that makes no sound. The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

Name: Malenia's Greaves
Info: Greaves of Arbitress Malenia
Caption: Greaves made of unalloyed gold. Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella. Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk. "My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god—he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."

Name: Elden Lord Greaves
Info: Greaves of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord
Caption: Greaves of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield. He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

Name: Knight Greaves
Info: Iron greaves worn by foreign knights
Caption: Iron greaves of an unknown knight. It is made of thin iron plate. Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.

Name: Vagabond Knight Greaves
Info: Greaves of a banished knight
Caption: Greaves of a knight banished from their motherland. Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey. Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

Name: Carian Knight Greaves
Info: Greaves of enchanted Carian knights
Caption: Greaves of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family. The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were all heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

Name: Godrick Knight Greaves
Info: Greaves used by Stormveil Elite Knights
Caption: Greaves worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted. Time has yet to dull their luster.

Name: Cuckoo Knight Greaves
Info: Greaves of Raya Lucaria Academy Elite Knights
Caption: Greaves worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights. Time has yet to dull their luster.

Name: Redmane Knight Greaves
Info: Greaves used by Elite Caelid Wilds Knights
Caption: Black iron greaves worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side. Time has yet to dull their luster.

Name: Gelmir Knight Greaves
Info: Greaves used by Capital Knights
Caption: Greaves worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard. Time has yet to dull their luster.

Name: Leyndell Knight Greaves
Info: Greaves used by Elite Capital Knights
Caption: Greaves worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. Time has yet to dull their luster.

Name: Haligtree Knight Greaves
Info: Greaves used by Elite Knights of Miquella
Caption: Greaves worn by knights sworn to the Haligtree. Time has yet to dull their luster.

Name: Mausoleum Knight Greaves
Info: Greaves used by Elite Mausoleum Knights
Caption: Greaves worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. Time has yet to dull their luster.

Name: Bloodhound Knight Greaves
Info: Beast-like greaves of the Bloodhound Knights
Caption: Metal greaves of the Bloodhound Knights. The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers. Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master. Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

Name: Cleanrot Greaves
Info: Greaves of a Wing Knight. Somewhat decayed...
Caption: Greaves of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering. The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.

Name: Raging Wolf Greaves
Info: Greaves of Vargram the Bloody Wolf
Caption: Greaves worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold. According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean, and this is what Vargram aspired to be.

Name: Hoslow's Greaves
Info: Greaves passed down through the Hoslow family
Caption: Garish silver greaves decorated with red embellishments. Passed down through the Hoslow family. When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused. "I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion."

Name: Twinned Greaves
Info: Greaves worn by D, Knight of the Golden Order
Caption: Greaves depicting entwined twins of gold and silver. The two known as D are inseparable twins. They are of two bodies and two minds, but one single soul. Not once do they stand together; not one word do they speak to one another. Perhaps this armor longs to find its way to the other D.

Name: Drake Knight Greaves
Info: Malformed greaves fused with dragon flesh
Caption: Black iron greaves by drake knights. Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion. From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe.

Name: Blaidd's Greaves
Info: Greaves of Blaidd, Knight of Ranni
Caption: Well-worn black greaves of the man-wolf Blaidd. Blaidd, who served as Ranni's shadow, was a loyal ally who would defy destiny itself if it would have him turn upon his Lady.

Name: Briar Greaves
Info: Greaves worn by Condor Knights
Caption: Battered greaves from a foreign land. Worn by Elemer of the Briar. The winding, rusted iron briars are a mark of the guilty, and typically indicate a sentence of death. Elemer murdered numerous instructors and merchants, and was known as the Bell Bearing Hunter.

Name: Fingerprint Greaves
Info: Deformed greaves of a mad knight in despair
Caption: Iron greaves singed and blistered by fingers. Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold. No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy. Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?

Name: Royal Remains Greaves
Info: Greaves that mediate via body of famed ancestor
Caption: Greaves graced with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing. Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced. It is said that the bones belong to an ancient lord―the soulless king. The lord of the lost and desperate, who was known as Ensha.

Name: All-Knowing Greaves
Info: Greaves of Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing
Caption: Greaves set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. At the end that should not be.

Name: Royal Knight Greaves
Info: Greaves of an Arbor Sentinel
Caption: Silver greaves of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree. Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

Name: Maliketh's Greaves
Info: Greaves of Maliketh the Black Blade
Caption: Beast's greaves made of black iron and decorated with gold. Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade. Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him. Champions knew what was at stake. Indeed, that is what made them champions.

Name: Banished Knight Greaves
Info: Knight's greaves, worn by salt winds and battle
Caption: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. These greaves were worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

Name: Night's Cavalry Greaves
Info: Greaves covered in blackened bloodstains
Caption: Pitch-black greaves thinly painted with dried blood. Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds. The Night's Cavalry, who now wander the dim roads of night, were once led by the Fell Omen and were deliverers of death for great warriors, knights, and champions.

Name: Veteran's Greaves
Info: Veteran General's old greaves
Caption: Old greaves that have seen many battles. Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol. Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master. This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

Name: Scaled Greaves
Info: Greaves made from layered ancient dragon scales
Caption: Greaves worn by Old Knight Istvan. The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it highly effective against non-physical attacks. Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survive to this day.

Name: Beast Champion Greaves
Info: Greaves of Belnahr the Traitor
Caption: Silver greaves engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant. Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was. Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

Name: Tree Sentinel Greaves
Info: Greaves of a Tree Sentinel
Caption: Golden greaves of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree. Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.

Name: Malformed Dragon Greaves
Info: Malformed, golden greaves used by Gnarrl
Caption: Malformed golden greaves. Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels. After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.

Name: Crucible Greaves
Info: Greaves used by the Crucible Knights
Caption: Greaves of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. Hold the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthen Aspects of the Crucible incantations. In time, the strength shown by these knights, and even their appearance, was seen as chaotic and deserving of scorn.

Name: Radahn's Greaves
Info: Greaves of Radahn, God of War
Caption: Greaves depicting the golden lion. Worn by General Radahn. The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.

Name: Lionel's Greaves
Info: Oddly shaped greaves used by foreign knights
Caption: Rounded iron greaves. Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted. When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself her father.

Name: Bull-Goat Greaves
Info: Great Horned Tragoth's greaves
Caption: Great Horned Tragoth's greaves, adorned with a gold bull-goat motif. Provide high poise. Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.

Name: Omen Greaves
Info: Greaves of a curse gnawed Omen
Caption: Malformed greaves resembling an Omen with its horns cut off. Worn by the Dung Eater, their form is a vision of the landscape of his mind, and of his appearance as he wished to see it. The heart of an Omen without the body to match; could there be any crueler existence? What does it matter, then, if the curse claims it all?

Name: Fire Prelate Greaves
Info: Fire Prelate greaves which resemble flames
Caption: Black iron greaves with the appearance of flames. Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks. The weighty frames of the Prelates symbolized the onus of their grave vows as guardians of the flame. "Etch this sight upon thine breast. Of my thunderous gravity."

Name: Ragged Loincloth
Info: Greaves pieced together from scavenged metal
Caption: Greaves pieced together from scavenged metal.

Name: Brave's Legwraps
Info: Greaves of a warrior of the frigid uplands
Caption: Greaves wrapped in thick leather. Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands. Has a fur lining which excels at keeping the cold at bay.

Name: Deathbed Smalls
Info: Skirt worn by Phia, the Deathbed Companion
Caption: Skirt worn by Phia, the Deathbed Companion.

Name: Millicent's Boots
Info: Boots worn by Millicent the Rotting
Caption: Boots worn by Millicent the Rotting
